What type of organism is commonly used in preparation of foods such as cheese and yogurt? [preparation]	mesophilic organisms
What phenomenon makes global winds blow northeast to southwest or the reverse in the northern hemisphere and northwest to southeast or the reverse in the southern hemisphere? [hemisphere]	coriolis effect
Changes from a less-ordered state to a more-ordered state (such as a liquid to a solid) are always what? [state]	exothermic
What is the least dangerous radioactive decay? [decay]	alpha decay
Kilauea in hawaii is the world’s most continuously active volcano. very active volcanoes characteristically eject red-hot rocks and lava rather than this? [world]	smoke and ash
When a meteoroid reaches earth, what is the remaining object called? [earth]	meteorite
What kind of a reaction occurs when a substance reacts quickly with oxygen? [substance]	combustion reaction
Organisms categorized by what species descriptor demonstrate a version of allopatric speciation and have limited regions of overlap with one another, but where they overlap they interbreed successfully?. [speciation]	ring species
Alpha emission is a type of what? [emission]	radioactivity
What is the stored food in a seed called? [food]	endosperm
Zinc is more easily oxidized than iron because zinc has a lower reduction potential. since zinc has a lower reduction potential, it is a more what? [zinc]	active metal
What is controlled by both genes and experiences in a given envionment? [gene]	animal behaviors
What tells you how much of the food you should eat to get the nutrients listed on the label? [food]	serving size
What are used to write nuclear equations for radioactive decay? [decay]	nuclear symbols
What is controlled by regulatory proteins that bind to regulatory elements on dna? [element]	gene transcription
Boron only occurs naturally in compounds with what element? [compound]	oxygen
What organ systems link exchange surfaces with cells throughout the body? [link]	circulatory
What occurs when the immune system attacks a harmless substance that enters the body from the outside? [substance]	allergy
Fertilization is the union of a sperm and egg, resulting in the formation of what? [fertilization]	a zygote
The plants alternation between haploid and diploud generations allow it to do what? [plant]	reproduce asexually and sexually
Most of the chemical reactions in the body are facilitated by what? [body]	enzymes
What is the termination of a pregnancy in progress called? [progress]	abortion
Cutting down on the use of chemical fertilizers and preserving wetlands are ways to prevent what "unlivable" regions in bodies of water? [way]	dead zones
Which muscles allow your fingers to also make precise movements for actions? [finger]	intrinsic muscles
Testing what usually requires making observations or performing experiments? [observation]	hypothesis
This sharing of electrons produces what is known as a covalent bond. covalent bonds are ~20 to 50 times stronger than what? [electron]	van der waals interactions
Water molecules move about continuously due to what type of energy? [type]	kinetic
A small scale version of what type of map displays individual rock units? [scale]	geologic map
What is defined as a change in the inherited traits of organisms over time? [organism]	evolution
What hormone, which is associated with luteinizing hormone and male sexuality, helps bring about physical changes in puberty? [puberty]	testosterone
Where do angiosperms produce seeds in flowers? [flower]	ovaries
In order to create food, what do photosynthetic protists use? [food]	light energy
What type of vertebrates are birds? [bird]	endothermic tetrapod
What type of ions do ionic compounds contain? [compound]	positive and negative
All living things need air and this to survive? [thing]	water
The cells of all eukarya have a what? [cell]	nucleus
What type of plate boundaries produce huge mountain ranges in the ocean basin? [plate]	divergent
Interstitial carbides are produced by the reaction of most transition metals at high temperatures with what element? [metal]	carbon
Fungus-like protist saprobes play what role in a food chain and are specialized to absorb nutrients from nonliving organic matter, such as dead organisms or their wastes? [protist]	decomposers
What are the sites of protein synthesis or assembly? [assembly]	ribosomes
What must replicate in the cell cycle before meiosis i takes place? [place]	dna
What phenomenon is primarily the result of plate tectonic motions? [plate]	earthquake
What is a group of neuron cell bodies in the periphery called? [body]	ganglion
Where does most of our food come from? [food]	angiosperms
Gases are most ideal at high temperature and what pressure? [temperature]	low
Hard igneous rocks and easily dissolved sedimentary rocks respond very differently to what natural force? [rock]	weathering
A diet rich in calcium and what vitamin may reduce the risk of osteoporosis and related bone fractures? [calcium]	vitamin d
How many people die from air pollution each year? [pollution]	22 million
What substances serve as catalysts in most of the biochemical reactions that take place in organisms? [substance]	enzymes
The formation of an amalgam allows the metal to react with what? [metal]	air and water
A pulley changes the direction of the force t exerted by the cord without changing its what? [direction]	magnitude
What is the name of the small bumps that contain taste buds and covers the tongue? [taste]	papillae
In the absence of air resistance, all falling objects accelerate at the same rate due to what force? [air]	gravity
The ability for a plasma membrane to only allow certain molecules in or out of the cell is referred to as what? [ability]	selective permeability
In the presence of oxygen, hydrogen can interact to make what? [oxygen]	water
What galaxy is our solar system a part of? [part]	milky way
The angle at which light bends when it enters a different medium is known as what? [medium]	refraction
Whether the organism is a bacterium, plant, or animal, all living things access energy by breaking down these? [animal]	carbohydrate molecules
Increasing the temperature of n2 molecules increases what energy of motion? [temperature]	kinetic energy
Which radio frequency should you listen to if you want less noise? [radio]	fm
What form of radiation is the energy emitted by the sun? [sun]	electromagnetic
What is the suns innermost layer called? [layer]	core
A growth spurt requires constant divisions of what? [growth]	cells
What's the term for the gradual progression from simple plants to larger more complex ones in an area? [term]	primary succession

Which cycle tracks the flow of nitrogen through an ecosystem? [ecosystem]	nitrogen cycle
What consequence of a tornado is responsible for most injuries and deaths? [death]	flying debris
What are the only truly innate behaviors in humans called? [behavior]	reflexes
What happens to the density of air as the altitude decreases? [density]	decreases
How do some animals change their depth? [depth]	by changing their density
What phenomenon is crowding out other species and making all the other causes of extinction worse? [phenomenon]	human overpopulation
Dessication is an extreme and usually fatal form of what in animals? [animal]	dehydration
Internal and external forms of what life process occur as simple diffusion due to a partial pressure gradient? [life]	respiration

Soluble minerals and clays accumulate in what soil layer, allowing it to hold more water? [layer]	subsoil
What is the common word for potential difference in a circuit? [word]	voltage
How many chambers does the stomach of a crocodile have? [chamber]	two
When populations get close to the carrying capacity, what happens to growth? [capacity]	slows
Although air can transfer heat rapidly by convection, it is a poor conductor and thus a good what? [heat]	insulator
Most plants grow continuously, except for what periods? [plant]	dormant
What man-made devices in space are used to observe the earth's surface? [device]	satellites
Carboxylic acids are weak acids, meaning they are not 100% ionized in what? [acid]	water
An endocrine disease usually involves the secretion of too much or not enough of what? [disease]	hormone
In experiments with garden peas, austrian monk gregor mendel described the basic patterns of what? [pattern]	inheritance

What are unsaturated hydrocarbons with at least one double bond between carbon atoms called? [carbon]	alkenes

Most of the pathogens that cause stis enter the body through mucous membranes of which organs? [cause]	reproductive organs
The activation of what kind of buds induces branching? [activation]	axillary buds
Sexual reproduction involves haploid gametes and produces a diploid zygote through what process? [zygote]	fertilization

What percentage of men suffer from some form of erectile dysfunction by age 40? [age]	approximately 40 percent
What secures together immovable joints and prevents them from moving? [joint]	dense collagen
Transform faults are the site of massive what? [site]	earthquakes
When water goes above and below its freezing point, what rock-breaking phenomenon is common? [rock]	ice wedging

What type of reactions form compounds? [compound]	chemical reactions
Millions of years ago, plants used energy from the sun to form what? [sun]	carbon compounds
What is the term for the process in which living things with beneficial traits produce more offspring than others do? [term]	natural selection
In a chemical reaction, the amounts of reactants and products will be constant when what state is attained? [product]	equilibrium
What protects a developing flower while it is still a bud? [flower]	sepals
What is the term for the force of attraction between things that have a mass? [attraction]	gravity
What are the long, thin protein extensions in most prokaryotic cells called? [protein]	flagellum

What does lattice energy of an ionic solid measure the strength of? [strength]	bonds
How many different types of taste can be detected by taste buds? [taste]	five
What species do humans belong to? [human]	homo sapiens
Titration is a method to determine what in acids or bases? [basis]	concentration
How many different amino acids make up proteins. [protein]	20
What are sores in the lining of the stomach or duodenum that are usually caused by bacterial infections or acidity? [lining]	ulcers
In some species, what has led to the evolution of alternative male mating behavior and morphology? [behavior]	sexual selection
What structure is made from dna and protein molecules coiled together? [protein]	chromosome
What renewable energy source converts energy from the sunlight into electricity? [sunlight]	solar energy

What is the lowest layer of the atmosphere? [layer]	troposphere

What are made from highly reflective metal that is applied to a curved or flat piece of glass? [metal]	mirrors

What helps the plasma membrane keep its shape? [shape]	molecules of cholesterol

What is it called when you get the same result after repeating an experiment? [call]	replication

What are the 2 primary hosts of ebola in central africa? [host]	apes and bats
Unlike prokaryotic cells, dna and rna synthesis in eukaryotic cells occurs in a separate compartment from synthesis of what? [synthesis]	protein
What important organelle (that would otherwise be centrally located and crucial to the cell's survival) do prokaryotic cells lack? [survival]	nucleus
What is the outer layer of an axon that acts like a layer of insulation, similar to the plastic that encases an electrical cord? [axon]	myelin sheath
What occurs when some members of a species become geographically separated? [member]	allopatric speciation

What is the term for a mixture of two or more substances that has the same composition throughout? [substance]	solution
What are flagellate protozoa that cause giardiasis? [cause]	giardia

What are the contacts between neurons called? [contact]	synapses
What is the color of the powder of a mineral? [mineral]	streak

What type of compound is essential to life? [compound]	water
Which part of the ear amplifies the sound waves? [sound]	middle ear

What is a group of connected cells that have a similar function within an organism called? [call]	tissue

What do scientist's believe mercury's core is mostly made of? [s]	melted iron
What material comprises the sun and other stars, as well as lightning and the northern lights? [sun]	plasma
The function of which organ is to filter blood and form urine? [urine]	kidneys

What process is at work when warm air or water rises, and cool air or water sinks? [process]	convection

How much space a surface covers is known as what? [space]	area

What is used to report the results of scientific measurements? [measurement]	si units
What is the first digestive organ that food enters? [food]	mouth
Insulin is made up of how many polypeptide chains? [insulin]	two
What is the term for the energy of movement? [term]	mechanical energy
What type of organisms are helpless at birth and require lots of help from their parents? [type]	altricial organisms
Metallic bonds allow metals to do what, in the manner of a willow tree? [metal]	bend without breaking
What is a substance that can not be broken down any further into other substances? [substance]	pure substance
What three characteristics do waves have? [characteristic]	reflection, refraction and deflection
What organ creates bile? [bile]	liver
What is the smallest and most fundamental unit of matter, consisting of a nucleus surrounded by electrons? [unit]	atom
Mutation of beneficial proto-oncogenes is a prime culprit in what disease? [oncogene]	cancer
What happens to charges whenever they are accelerated? [charge]	they radiate
What is it in bone marrow transplants that may cause a graft versus host reaction? [cause]	lymphocytes
The vagina starts at the vulva and ends where? [vulva]	the uterus
Regulatory proteins bind to regulatory elements to control what? [element]	transcription
What term is used for any combination of two or more atoms? [term]	molecule
What is biomass made into fuel called? [call]	bio fuel
What type of thin lava forms shapes and tubes as it flows? [shape]	pāhoehoe
The nucleolus, which makes ribosomes, is located within what cell structure? [ribosome]	nucleus
Electrons flow through the electrolyte from the ________ to __________ electrode. [electrolyte]	negative; positive
What is the name of the part that connects the vagina with the uterus? [uterus]	cervix
No-till farming is one effort to combat what, caused by typical farming practices? [effort]	soil erosion
Geysers are created when what is heated beneath the earth's surface? [earth]	water
Increasing voltage with a higher-volt battery does what to the current? [voltage]	increases it
Hydrogen peroxide will decompose over time to produce _______ gas. [peroxide]	water and oxygen
What kind of pipettes are suitable for measuring very small amounts of liquids? [liquid]	micropipettes
What is the measure of the force of gravity pulling down on an object called? [gravity]	weight
Boiling points increase with which kind of mass? [mass]	molar mass
The largest absorption of heat comes during the vaporization of what? [absorption]	liquid water
What do fungi absorb to get their nutrition? [fungus]	organic compounds from other organisms

A yolk sac replaces what structure for nourishing a marsupial embryo? [embryo]	placenta
What is the pressure of gas in a gas mixture termed? [term]	partial pressure
Making ups about 50 percent of the modern american diet, what food group can be classified according to the number of monomers they contain of simple sugars and/or complex sugars? [monomer]	carbohydrates
What is the process of the fusion of a sperm and an egg called? [call]	fertilization
What is the motion that moves the forearm from the supinated position to the pronated position? [position]	pronation

What does it mean to be a diploid organism? [organism]	organism has two copies of each gene

The chemical behavior of elements can largely be explained by what? [behavior]	electron configurations
Metalloids, metals, and nonmetals are all classes of what? [class]	elements
How does air always flow? [air]	high to low
What type of invisible waves are used in microwaves? [type]	radiation
Which muscular organ pumps blood all around your body? [body]	heart
What causes the changes of puberty? [cause]	estrogen
If a sedimentary rock layer is not horizontal, what is it? [layer]	deformed
What system, which includes the skin, plays important roles in protection, sensing stimuli and thermoregulation? [protection]	integumentary system
What type of plant tissue transports water and dissolved mineral upward to the leaves? [tissue]	xylem
What can lenses be used to make? [lense]	visual representations
Surface tension is a property of matter that is in what state? [tension]	liquid

What is the main component of paper, cardboard, and textiles made from cotton, linen, and other plant fibers? [plant]	cellulose
What theory explains the physical behavior of gases? [behavior]	kinetic theory of gases

What is the largest artery in the body called? [body]	aorta

Hardness, density, color, and melting and boiling points are all considered what types of properties? [density]	physical

What type of chemistry is the study of the composition of matter? [chemistry]	analytical

What consists of all the living things and nonliving things interacting in the same area? [thing]	ecosystem
How much can the bacteria in your gut weigh? [can]	2 pounds

The active site can only bind certain what? [site]	substrates

What organism is the most disruptive towards the diversity of other species? [diversity]	humans
Migration and hibernation are examples of behaviors that occur on what temporal basis? [behavior]	annual

What occurs in a formerly inhabited area that was disturbed? [area]	secondary succession

What determines the unique sequence for every protein? [sequence]	gene encoding

What can be thought of as the capacity a device has for storing charge? [charge]	capacitance
What do electromagnetic receptors detect? [receptor]	electromagnetic radiation
Nutrients from food are absorbed by the blood for transport around the body as part of what system? [part]	digestive
What occurs when plants release water vapor through stomata (leaf pores)? [vapor]	transpiration

What is the lowest energy state of the atom called? [state]	ground state

When is melatonin secreted? [melatonin]	at night

What are ionic solutes? [solute]	electrolytes

What has the average global temperature done since the 1900s? [temperature]	risen
An solid object with an irregular shape can be measured via what method? [shape]	displacement
Deterioration of limestone occurs more rapidly as the concentration of what increases? [concentration]	air pollutants

Where does digestion take place within an incomplete digestive system? [place]	gastrovascular cavity

Gene expression is regulated primarily at the what level? [expression]	transcriptional
What nullified the idea that all biological catalysts are proteins? [idea]	discovery of ribozymes
A tadpole turns into what land mammal? [tadpole]	a frog
In physics, what do you call devices that make work easier? [device]	machines
Mars appears red because of large amounts of which element in the soil? [soil]	iron
What type of rocks are laid down horizontally with the oldest at the bottom? [rock]	sedimentary
What are two types of frozen percipitation? [type]	snow and hail
The bond between the two nitrogen atoms is a what? [nitrogen]	triple bond
Starch is a large, complex carbohydrate made of thousands of _____ joined together? [thousand]	glucose units (monomers)
Newly duplicated chromosomes are divided into two daughter nuclei during what stage? [duplicate]	mitosis
As an erythrocyte matures in the red bone marrow, it extrudes its nucleus and most of its other what? [erythrocyte]	organelles
What is the tube-like device used to reliably measure lower levels of radiation? [device]	geiger counter
The conducting zone of the respiratory system includes the organs and structures not directly involved in what? [zone]	gas exchange
Aflatoxins are toxic, carcinogenic compounds released by fungi of this? [compound]	genus aspergillus
Four haploid spermatids form during meiosis from what? [meiosis]	the primary spermatocyte
Like people with type 1 diabetes, people with type 2 diabetes must frequently check what level? [type]	blood sugar
Many species in rhizaria are among the organisms referred to as what? [organism]	amoebas
What is the amount actually produced in a reaction called? [call]	actual yield
Each group of organisms went through its own evolutionary journey, called what? [organism]	phylogeny
What term refers to the emission of material or energy from an atom's nucleus? [term]	radioactivity
Which feature in maps allows users to make corrections between magnetic north and true north? [user]	double compass rose
What is the term for the maintenance of a steady state despite internal and external changes? [term]	homeostasis
Any structure inside a cell that is enclosed by a membrane is called? [membrane]	an organelle
The earliest vertebrates were jawless what? [vertebrate]	fish
In which kind of water can less carbon dioxide dissolve? [carbon]	warm water
The cochlea is a shell-like structure that is full of fluid and lined with nerve cells called what? [cochlea]	hair cells
What is an electrically neutral compound with positive and negative ions? [compound]	ionic compound
Which direction does the sun, moon, and stars appear to travel? [direction]	east to west
Sulfate is used as a cleaning agent because it is acidic and soluble in what substance? [substance]	water
Triceps and biceps muscles in the upper arm are an example of what type of muscle relationship? [type]	opposing
Internal metabolism and the external environment are the sources of heat for what? [heat]	thermoregulation
What is another term for stored energy? [term]	potential energy
What  occur when elements switch places in compounds? [compound]	replacement reactions
What does the human heart do? [human]	pump blood
What bond is the force of attraction that holds together positive and negative ions? [attraction]	ionic
There are five primary tastes in humans: sweet, sour, bitter, salty, and what? [taste]	umami
Are birds and mammals mainly exothermic or endothermic? [bird]	endothermic
What are the high points in a transverse wave called? [wave]	crests
Chemistry and physics are fields in what type of science? [chemistry]	physical
Pyramids of net production and biomass reflect what level of efficiency? [net]	low
The rate of flow of charge in an electrical circuit is known as what? [charge]	current
The vertebrate endoskeleton can also be called what? [endoskeleton]	internal skeleton
What can be used to speed up biochemical reactions? [speed]	enzymes
The abundance of this substance in the atmosphere is what most scientist agree that is causing global warming? [cause]	carbon dioxide
Most cases of syphilis can be cured with what? [case]	antibiotics
How can people access water in an aquifer that does not flow from a spring or a geyser? [aquifer]	dig a well
What is the term for animals that have a backbone? [term]	vertebrates
What type of animal that eats only or mainly insects? [type]	heterotrophic
What do you call the zone in a body of water where there is too little sunlight for photosynthesis? [body]	aphotic zone
The sweat glands of the armpit are classified as these? [gland]	apocrine glands
Chitin is a substance that is found in what part of animals like beetles and lobsters? [lobster]	shell
What kind of air does a continental polar air mass hold? [mass]	cold dry air
What do you call taxes placed on products that produce carbon dioxide? [product]	carbon taxes
What does the coefficient in front of an element in a formula indicate? [element]	how much is involved in the reaction
Behaviors that occur naturally and are not learned are called what? [behavior]	innate
Which is the dominant stage of the lifecycle of a fern? [stage]	sporophyte
What is a specific region in space within which a sensory receptor is responsive to stimuli? [space]	receptive field

Do most substances increase or decrease in size when they change from a liquid to a solid? [substance]	decrease
The highest point of a wave is called? [wave]	crest
What is the smallest part of an element called? [call]	atom

What are external skeletons known as? [skeleton]	exoskeletons
What is the name for the process where data in the genes is transferred to amino acids? [gene]	translation

What part of the muscle fibers cause shortening and contraction? [part]	myofibrils

What is the name of the mechanism in which sounds are encoded in microwaves by changing their frequency? [sound]	frequency modulation

[attention]	fourth

What are hydrocarbons that contain only single bonds between carbon atoms called? [carbon]	saturated hydrocarbons
The presence of what makes soil hold together more tightly and enables it to hold more water? [presence]	clay
What kind of anatomical structure consists of several types of tissues that together carry out particular functions? [tissue]	organ
How many pathways do plants have for carbon fixation? [pathway]	three
What is used to measure electric current? [current]	galvanometer
What connects the fetus to the placenta? [fetus]	umbilical cord
When your body digests food, it breaks down the molecules of nutrients and releases what? [nutrient]	energy
The first period of the paleozoic era was called what? [era]	cambrian
What is a molecule with two fatty acids and a modified phosphate group attached to a glycerol backbone? [phosphate]	phospholipid
Some women experience cramping and pain before and during what monthly cycle? [cycle]	menstruation
What is the attraction of oppositely charged ions caused by electron transfer called? [attraction]	ionic bond
What process converts the sun's hydrogen nuclei into helium? [sun]	nuclear fusion
Both solids and liquids hold a definite what? [liquid]	volume
Because the fields that make up an electromagnetic wave are at right angles to each other and to the direction that the wave travels, an electromagnetic wave is considered what? [direction]	transverse wave
Which measure indicates the number of electrons in a given sublevel? [electron]	superscripts
Because force and electric field are what, they have direction as well as their value? [field]	vectors
Acceleration is a vector, and thus has a both a magnitude and what else? [acceleration]	direction
What is it called when individual organisms work together with one another? [individual]	cooperation
How thick is the earth's continental crust, on average? [earth]	35 kilometers
Which organ has a thick mucus lining that protects the underlying tissue from the action of the digestive juices? [lining]	stomach
What historical event taught people that soil could be lost by plowing and growing crops and encouraged new methods to prevent erosion? [method]	the dust bowl
In what phase is the moon brightly illuminated? [phase]	full moon
What do vectors possess that scalars do not? [vector]	magnitude and direction
What are the food making factories of plants? [factory]	leaves
What does a pollinator pick from its body and carry directly to another plant of the same species? [body]	pollen
Melting ice cubes and freezing water are examples of change of what? [water]	state
What is the term for heterotrophs that eat only or mainly animals? [term]	carnivores
How much work is done when a force is applied in a different direction than the direction of movement? [direction]	none
The mercury or alcohol in a common glass what changes its volume as the temperature changes? [glass]	thermometer
What are commonly used to control insect pests, but can have harmful effects on the environment? [environment]	insecticides
The components of what keep their own identity when they combine and can usually be easily separated? [component]	mixture
What type of light can mosquitoes see? [type]	infared
What subject is a way of learning about the natural world that is based on evidence and logic? [way]	science
Chloroplasts are present only in cells of eukaryotes capable of what process? [eukaryote]	photosynthesis
Shielding should be used when receiving x-rays to limit exposure to what potentially harmful form of energy? [exposure]	radiation
What is the way animals act either alone or with other animals called? [way]	animal behavior
What three primary colors of light can be distinguished by the human eye? [light]	red, green, blue
Which body system releases hormones that act on target cells to regulate development, growth, energy metabolism, reproduction, and many behaviors? [behavior]	endocrine system
What is the main difference between eukaryotic and prokaryotic cells? [difference]	eukaryotic cells have a nucleus
What forms when cells start to grow out of control? [cell]	tumor
Organs, vessels, and lymph make up what system? [lymph]	lymphatic
Like the marketplace, the metabolic economy is regulated by what basic principle? [economy]	supply and demand
As roots grow longer they will always do what? [will]	grow downward
Which virus causes cold sores? [cause]	herpes virus
Duplicated chromosomes are composed of two sister what? [sister]	chromatids
What is the name of anything that has mass and takes up space? [space]	matter
The units of time, day and year are based on what? [time]	motions of earth
What is the term for an amount of force pushing against a given area? [term]	pressure
What is the region called where an electron is most likely to be found? [electron]	the orbital
Many glasses eventually crystallize, rendering them brittle and this? [glass]	opaque
What is magnetism produced by an electrical current? [magnetism]	electromagnetism
A weak and temporary dipole that influences nearby atoms through electrostatic attraction and repulsion is known as what? [attraction]	an instantaneous dipole

What helps the cell continually renew itself? [cell]	lysosomes
One of the fundamental laws of chemistry deals with the fact that we cannot create or destroy what? [chemistry]	matter
What are the tiny, tube-shaped structures found inside a kidney called? [kidney]	nephrons
How many sperm does it take to fertilize an egg? [sperm]	one
What type of climate is found mostly near the equator? [climate]	warm tropical
Metabolism is the collection of what that occur in an organism? [collection]	chemical reactions
What is the arrangement of a t-tubule with the membranes of sr on either side called? [arrangement]	triad
What is the name of the order that salamanders belong to? [salamander]	urodela

Where does most geological activity take place? [place]	plate boundaries
What can be used to mechanically separate the two elements by attracting the iron filings out of the mixture and leaving the sulfur behind? [sulfur]	magnet
What forms when a solute dissolves in a solvent? [solvent]	solution

Virtually all aquatic organisms depend directly or indirectly on what for food? [organism]	protists

What connects the two hemispheres of the brain? [brain]	corpus callosum
Cells like a prokaryotic cell, a eukaryotic cell has a plasma membrane, cytoplasm, and ribosomes, but a eukaryotic cell is typically larger than a prokaryotic cell, has a true nucleus (meaning its dna is surrounded by a membrane), and has other membrane-bound organelles that allow for what? [cytoplasm]	compartmentalization of functions

[electron]	two atoms

What simple machine consists of a bar that rotates around a fixed point called the fulcrum? [bar]	lever
Which carbohydrate is produced by photosynthesis? [photosynthesis]	glucose
What term is used to describe the line of latitude right in the middle of the planet? [term]	equator
What is the opening formed between adjacent vertebrae for the exit of a spinal nerve called? [nerve]	intervertebral foramen
What two planets is the asteroid belt found between? [belt]	mars and jupiter
Neon is an example of what kind of gas? [kind]	noble

What type of compound is hydrogen chloride? [compound]	covalent

The smallest part of an element that maintains the identity of that element is called what? [identity]	atom
Varves form in lakes covered by what? [lake]	ice
Speed takes distance and what else into account? [account]	time
Which division of the autonomic nervous system controls processes like digestion, heartbeat, and breathing? [heartbeat]	parasympathetic
What does the ovule develop into after fertilization? [ovule]	seed

Line graphs are especially useful for showing changes over what? [line]	time

What helps to regulate consciousness, arousal, and sleep states? [state]	thalamus

What type of roots enable a plant to grow on another plant? [type]	epiphytic
What is the distance north or south of the equator called? [call]	latitude

What kind of waves are electromagnetic waves? [wave]	transverse
What process is involved in the formation of a waterfall, when a stream flows from an area of harder to softer rock? [area]	erosion

What substances are involved in most of the chemical reactions that take place in organisms, including digestion? [place]	enzymes
What occurs when the immune system is not working properly? [system]	immunodeficiency
The force that a magnet exerts on certain materials is called what? [material]	magnetic force
What is applied to a rock to make it bend and flow? [rock]	stress

What is something that all machines must overcome? [machine]	friction

What is the name of the group that rats are apart of called? [group]	rodents
Fertilization occurs when what material from one flower reaches the female gametes in the same or a different flower? [flower]	pollen
What are the tiny packets of energy the sun gives off called? [sun]	photons
In humans, each set of chromosomes contains 22 of these and 1 sex chromosome? [sex]	autosomes
What eukaryotic organisms cannot make their own food and do not technically eat? [organism]	fungi
What do ants and termites eat to help them digest wood and leaves? [termite]	fungi
How many types of glands does the dermis contain? [type]	two
What is an upward force that fluids exert on any object that is placed in them? [place]	buoyant force

When sand is deposited along a shoreline, what is created? [sand]	beach

What are the mass of threadlike filaments on the body of a fungus called? [fungus]	hyphae

Cytokinins promote cell division and prevent what? [cell]	senescence
Dna transcription is controlled by what type of proteins? [type]	regulatory
Tubeworms deep in the galapagos rift get their energy from what type of bacteria? [type]	chemosynthetic

Oceans are divided into zones bases on distance from shore and what other factor? [shore]	water depth

The common earthworm and leeches are examples of what type of worm? [example]	segmented
Elements involved in nuclear reactions are what? [element]	radioactive

What is the source of most electricity? [source]	coal
What kind of motion characterizes waves? [wave]	repetitive

What makes up the mass number of an atom? [mass]	protons and neutrons

What is defined as force per unit area? [area]	pressure

[locomotion]	waste exchange

Reducing the production of what gas, or removing it from the air, are practices that could reduce global warming? [production]	carbon dioxide
There are a series of rules for naming branched alkanes (and, ultimately, for all organic compounds). these rules make up the system of nomenclature for naming what? [nomenclature]	organic molecules
Which theory helps predict future events in weather? [weather]	climate change theory
What is defined as a group of living and nonliving things and their environment? [thing]	ecosystem
Cancer is caused by mutations, which can be caused by pathogens, chemicals, or what else? [cause]	radiation
What is the term for a mutually beneficial relationship in which one organism lives inside the other? [term]	endosymbiosis
All new alleles are formed by what types of mutations? [allele]	random
What are seeds plants that produce naked seeds in cones called? [call]	gymnosperms
Water is the solvent in solutions called acids and? [solution]	bases
What two gases are the main components of air? [component]	nitrogen and oxygen
Anaerobic prokaryotes can live without what compound in their environment (it's a compound that people do need to live)? [environment]	oxygen
What part of earth do many animals use for navigation? [part]	magnetic field
Endocytosis and exocytosis are types of vesicle transport that carry very large molecules across what structure? [vesicle]	cell membrane
What are biochemical compounds that living things use to store energy and make cell membranes? [compound]	lipids
What happens to the volume of a balloon when you add moles of gas to it by blowing up? [blow]	increases
The addition of starting materials and the removal of end products prevent metabolism from reaching what state? [product]	equilibrium
In what year was the hardy-weinberg theorem formulated? [year]	1908
The regulation of gene expression is extremely important during the development of what? [expression]	organism
What does a virus inject into the host cell? [host]	nucleic acid
Mutations in regulatory genes that normally control the cell cycle cause what? [cause]	cancer
Blood is made up of red blood cells, white blood cells, platelets, and what else? [platelet]	plasma
What is the term for the study of how living things interact with each other and with their environment? [term]	ecology
What takes place directly after developing a hypothesis in the scientific method process? [process]	testing the hypothesis
What should you use to protect your eyes from chemicals? [use]	eye goggles
Because action potentials are so brief, a neuron can produce hundreds per what? [can]	second
Darwin coined what term to refer to an organism’s relative ability to survive and produce fertile offspring? [term]	fitness
At high pressures, how are the molecules of a gas crowded? [pressure]	closer together
The number of possible isomers increases tremendously as carbon skeletons increase in what? [skeleton]	size
What are vascular plants that produce seeds in cones called? [call]	gymnosperms
What does photosynthesis change light energy into? [photosynthesis]	chemical energy
Addiction affects what type of chemical receptors within the brain? [brain]	dopamine receptors
What is the ability of an atom to emit, or give off, charged particles and energy from the nucleus? [ability]	radioactivity
What group of gases are unusually unreactive? [group]	noble gases
A point defect can be an atom missing from a site in the crystal known as a what? [defect]	vacancy
What is the place called where the axon of one neuron meets the dendrite of another? [axon]	synapse
Organic chemistry is the study of the chemistry of what? [chemistry]	carbon compounds
Gastropods, cephalopods, and bivalves are examples of what class? [class]	mollusks
What type of cholesterol is commonly referred to as bad? [type]	ldl
Where does most natural gas come from? [gas]	wells that produce petroleum
Medical problems associated with the body responding poorly to insulin are commonly associated with what disease? [insulin]	diabetes
The pancreatic hormones insulin and glucagon maintain glucose homeostasis by tightly regulating the synthesis and breakdown of what? [synthesis]	glycogen
The marsupial embryo is nourished inside the uterus with food from a yolk sac instead of through a what? [yolk]	placenta
The substances that comprise heterogeneous mixtures can also be separated by what means? [substance]	physical
What type of organism has spores that are spread by water and wind? [type]	fungi
Through which organ do hookworm larvae enter the human body? [body]	through the skin
Inside a cylinder, thermal energy is converted to what type of energy of the moving piston? [type]	kinetic energy
To the extent that behaviors are controlled by what, they may evolve through natural selection? [behavior]	genes
What kind of muscle relationship generally produces back-and-forth movement of a body part? [part]	antagonistic muscles
Science is a process of knowing about the natural universe through what two actions? [process]	observation and experimentation
Through a process called electromagnetic induction, generators change what energy form of a spinning turbine to electrical energy? [turbine]	kinetic
Footprints, burrows, and waste are considered what type of fossils? [burrow]	trace fossils
What process of allows multicellular organisms to grow and repair themselves? [organism]	cell division
What is the process of a confined gas escaping through a tiny hole in its container called? [call]	effusion
What is a relationship between living things that depend on the same resources? [resource]	competition
What is the measure of an individual’s weight-to-height ratio called? [call]	body mass index (bmi)
When you are walking on a sidewalk, what occurs between your shoes and the concrete each time you put down your foot? [sidewalk]	static friction
According to the english system measurement, how much is equal to 2 pints, 1 quart, and ¼ of a gallon? [measurement]	4 cups
Many important crops, such as corn, are planted and harvested as what? [crop]	seeds
The turbine of a windmill spins and creates what? [turbine]	electricity
Found in cord blood and other sources, what kind of cells hold the promise of renewing and repairing body tissues? [tissue]	stem cells
Which law explains why a ship weighing thousands of metric tons floats on water? [thousand]	archimedes' law
The urinary system can be considered a smaller part of what other body system? [body]	excretory
Essential minerals that the body needs in tiny quantities are called what? [body]	trace minerals
The process by which leaves collect sunlight and make food is called this? [sunlight]	photosynthesis
What are the three types of rna involved in protein synthesis? [synthesis]	messenger, transfer, and ribosomal
What is the term for chordates with a vertebral column and endoskeleton of cartilage and bone? [term]	vertebrate
What does a keratometer measure in the cornea? [cornea]	curve
What is it called when an egg develops into an individual without being fertilized? [individual]	parthenogenesis

Through what does the nerve impulses travel to the brain? [nerve]	optic nerve
The difference in electric potential energy which allows for an electric charge to move from one position to another is measured by what si unit? [difference]	volt
The properties of the alkali metals are similar to each other as expected for elements in the same what? [metal]	family

An ether is an organic compound in which two hydrocarbon groups are bonded to the same atom of what? [atom]	oxygen

What controls the movements of hands and arms? [movement]	somatic nervous system
Refraction happens when light bends from doing what in a new medium? [medium]	changing speed
What is the basic structure that holds plants upright, allowing plants to get the sunlight and air they need? [sunlight]	stem

What is the most numerous species on the planet? [planet]	bacteria

What are scientists called who study the weather and give forecasts? [weather]	meteorologists

Both dna and rna are what type of acids? [type]	nucleic acids
What kind of a resource is soil, for human purposes? [purpose]	nonrenewable resource

What is at the surface of a cell, arranged in similar bilayer? [cell]	phospholipids

What is the average number of individuals per unit of area or volume called? [unit]	population density

Red blood cells, white blood cells, and platelets are all produced where? [platelet]	in red marrow

Pseudopods are temporary extensions of what? [pseudopod]	the cytoplasm
Ice cubes in cola cause the cola to lose what? [cube]	thermal energy
How are protists traditionally classified? [protist]	animal-like, plant-like, or fungi-like
Coal is a solid hydrocarbon formed from what type of decaying material? [decay]	plant
Many disciplines within the study of biology contribute to understanding how past and present life evolved over time; these disciplines together contribute to building, updating, and maintaining this? [time]	tree of life
A flow of one coulomb per second is called one ampere, which is a measure of what? [second]	electric current
What might eventually happen to a species if it is unable to reproduce? [may]	extinction
What do muscles need to contract? [muscle]	stimulus
What is considered to be a unique feature of echinoderms? [echinoderm]	water vascular system
Noninfectious diseases can't be passed from one person to another. instead, these types of diseases are caused by factors such as environment, genetics and what? [environment]	lifestyle
What 'counting' instrument is used to measure radioactivity? [instrument]	geiger counter
Often primary producers, what term describes species considered the “base” or “bedrock” of a community, having the greatest influence on its overall structure? [producer]	foundation
Hurricanes that form in the tropics are called what? [call]	tropical cyclones
What types of flat maps show users changes in land elevation? [land]	topographic maps
Sister chromatids separate as part of anaphase in what process? [part]	mitosis
Vertebrates evolved from primitive forms of which creature? [creature]	chordates
Another name for table salt is? [table]	sodium chloride
In iceland, the mid-atlantic ridge is above sea what? [sea]	level
The earth's atmosphere, climate, and living things are effected by what feature that covers more than 70 percent of earth's surface? [effect]	oceans
What is the nest of cell an egg rests in called? [call]	follicle
The energy of a wave depends on time as well as what other property of the wave? [property]	amplitude
Genetic equilibrium occurs when what process doesn't exist within the population? [equilibrium]	evolution
During meiosis, each parent synthesizes gametes that contain only half of their complement of what? [meiosis]	chromosomes
What is evolution that occurs over a long period of time called? [evolution]	macroevolution
What is the plasma membrane formed by? [membrane]	a phospholipid bilayer
What is formed when an element gains one or more electrons? [electron]	anion
What is the term for the slow wearing down of rocks on earth’s surface? [term]	weathering
Lobsters are what kind of food source? [source]	arthropod
Helicopters store large amounts of rotational energy of what type in their blades? [helicopter]	kinetic
What branch of science is the study of matter and energy? [matter]	physical science
Plants and algae maintain the atmosphere. during photosynthesis, they add oxygen and remove what? [oxygen]	carbon dioxide
Electric substations have what devices, which use electromagnetic induction to increase or decrease the voltage of the current? [device]	transformers
By what process does oxygen enter the pores of flatworms? [process]	diffusion
The iconic gray mantle of the human brain, which appears to make up most of the mass of the brain, is called? [mantle]	cerebrum
What kind of rocks form as an existing rock is altered by high temperature or pressure? [temperature]	metamorphic
What kind of water are cattails adapted for with narrow, strap-like leaves? [cattail]	moving water
What is the most abundant living thing on earth that can be found in almost any environment? [earth]	bacteria
Oxidation does not necessarily require heating. which is the common and natural method of oxidation? [oxidation]	rusting
Toward the late stages of pregnancy, a drop in progesterone and stretching forces from the fetus lead to increasing uterine irritability and prompt labor. contractions serve to dilate the cervix and expel this? [lead]	newborn
Light bends when it passes in from what to what? [light]	air to water

What is the basic unit of computer memory? [computer]	byte
What is the first part of the large intestine, where wastes enter from the small intestine? [part]	the cecum
Burning fossil fuels produces air pollution and what? [fuel]	carbon dioxide
Monosaccharides, particularly glucose, are major nutrients for what? [nutrient]	cells
Covalent solids are formed by networks or chains of atoms or molecules held together by what? [network]	covalent bonds

The grasp reflex in humans is an example of what kind of behavior? [behavior]	innate
Antibiotics can cure most infections that are caused by what? [infection]	bacteria
Hydrocarbons are made up of carbon and what else? [carbon]	hydrogen
Archaeal cell walls contain a variety of polysaccharides and proteins but lack what? [polysaccharide]	peptidoglycan
What are lipids' function in relation to nerves? [relation]	protection
Crystallization separates mixtures based on differences in what, which usually increases with temperature? [difference]	solubility
Pure substances have a constant composition and can only be changed through what? [substance]	chemical reactions
Which water from the equator mixes with cold water from the poles? [pole]	warm
In order to determine its molecular formula, it is necessary to know what about the compound? [compound]	molar mass
What is the term for much bigger evolutionary changes that result in new species? [term]	macroevolution
What are the effects of light on plant morphology called? [call]	photomorphogenesis
In a magnet, what are the regions called that are the strongest? [region]	poles
What kind of muscle cells undergo twitch-type contractions with long refractory periods followed by brief relaxation periods, allowing the heart to fill with blood for the next cycle? [muscle]	cardiac muscle
What is a factor in determining weight but not mass? [weight]	location
What occurs when two nonpolar liquids are mixed? [liquid]	nonpolar-nonpolar interactions

What process involves two cell divisions and produces four haploid cells? [process]	meiosis
What happens to a chain of amino acids after it reaches a stop codon? [chain]	released from the ribosome
How many electrons can be accommodated in the first electron shell's orbital? [s]	2

What are the strongest magnets made? [magnet]	electromagnets

What is the name of the major sex hormone in females? [sex]	estrogen
What is the smallest unit of a living thing? [thing]	cell
What kind of metals have perplexing patterns of electron distribution that don’t always follow the electron filling rules? [rule]	transition

Atmospheric pressure can be measured with what tool? [tool]	barometer
What kind of charge do electrons have? [charge]	negative
What are lipids that contain phosphorus called? [call]	phospholipids
How many chambers does the stomach of a ruminant have? [chamber]	4
What states that chemical reactions occur when atoms, ions, or molecules collide? [molecule]	collision theory
What do you call the membrane lining the back of the eye? [back]	retina
Lacking blood vessels, nerve endings, or glands, the epidermis is the outer layer of what? [ending]	skin
The deepest region of the adrenal cortex is the zona reticularis, which produces small amounts of a class of steroid sex hormones called what? [cortex]	androgens
All living things maintain a stable internal environment through what process? [stable]	homeostasis
Tropical rainforests are an example of a climate that occurs near what? [climate]	equator
What changes the chemical composition of a substance and can only occur through a chemical reaction? [composition]	chemical changes
What term is used to describe the way that animals interact with each other or their environment? [term]	animal behavior
What kind of bees are most adult bees in a hive? [hive]	worker bees
In most animals, the circulatory system is used to transport blood through the what? [animal]	body
In sexually reproducing organisms, parents pass a copy of each type of what to their offspring by producing gametes? [gamete]	chromosome
At transform plate boundaries, two plates move in which directions? [boundary]	opposite
The voltages generated at a power plant are stepped up by what passive devices, which then reduce voltage to a safe level at the point of use? [device]	transformers
What is the term for the dark brown or black coating found on exposed desert rocks, which is formed of iron and manganese oxides? [term]	desert varnish
What two ways may catalyst be classified? [way]	homogeneous or heterogeneous
What phylum has the highest number of species on earth? [earth]	arthropods
The speed of a wave is a product of its wavelength and what else? [product]	frequency
What type of gas are stars made up of? [type]	hydrogen
What are one of the most abundant organic molecules in living systems and have the most diverse range of functions of all macromolecules? [system]	proteins
A geiger counter is used for detecting what? [counter]	radiation
All species have evolved a pattern of living, called a life history strategy, in which they partition energy for growth, maintenance, and what? [maintenance]	reproduction
What are the most diverse plants on earth? [earth]	angiosperms
What is the second line of defense? [defense]	inflammatory response
What is the term for when organisms need other organisms to survive? [term]	interdependence
What  is an organic compound that is made up of only carbon and hydrogen? [compound]	a hydrocarbon
Bile salts produced by the liver assist in breaking apart what kind of fats? [kind]	dietary
Where does most of the sound we hear travel through? [sound]	air
A reptile's what doesn't generate enough energy to keep their body temperature stable? [stable]	metabolism
Bar, circle, and line are examples of what kind of data visualization? [circle]	graphs
What is the first phase of mitosis? [phase]	prophase
What term means an area where two closely related species continue to interact and reproduce? [term]	hybrid zone
Fungi may have both asexual and sexual stages of what? [stage]	reproduction
Geysers erupt because what boiling hot substance is trapped beneath their surface? [substance]	water
About one-third of the human cerebral cortex is dedicated to analyzing and perceiving information related to what sense? [information]	vision
Fungus-like protists are what kind of feeders? [protist]	absorptive
What is the process in which many new species evolve in a short period of time to fill available niches called? [time]	adaptive radiation
After fertilization, how many cells does a zygote form into? [zygote]	two
Which common oxidizing agent can be used to oxidize alcohols? [use]	potassium dichromate
What are gemstones known as when light cannot pass through them? [can]	opaque
In biology, a relationship that benefits both entities is known as what? [entity]	mutualism
Some animals prepare for the long winters by storing food and going dormant, a behavior called what? [behavior]	hibernation
Biochemical reactions are optimal at physiological temperatures because many what lose function at lower and higher temperatures? [temperature]	enzymes
What is the attachment of ducklings to their mother an example of? [attachment]	imprinting
In vascular plants, the sporophyte generation is what? [sporophyte]	dominant
The combined gradient that affects an ion includes its concentration gradient and its what? [ion]	electrical gradient
What is the first cell of a new organism? [organism]	zygote
What part of the cell in plants and algae does photosynthesis take place? [place]	organelles
Exemplified by canada and alaska, what kind of climate has cool, short summers and long, cold winters, little precipitation, and abundant conifers? [winter]	subarctic climate
What are the only organelles that prokaryotic cells have? [organelle]	ribosomes
What is the name of the cloud where most long-period comets come from? [cloud]	oort cloud
Different feeding "positions" in a food chain or web are associated with what kinds of levels? [level]	trophic
Ionic compound atoms of various elements gain or lose electrons to? [compound]	produce ions
Sedimentary rocks form in what kind of layers? [layer]	horizontal
Plants obtain the molecules for cellular function though what? [plant]	photosynthesis
The group of plants that can make their own food from inorganic raw materials in the presence of sunlight are referred to as what? [plant]	autotrophic
What type of disorders are caused by mutations in genes or abnormal numbers of chromosomes? [cause]	genetic disorders
What is the measure of sound intensity levels? [sound]	decibels
What is the temperature at which a substance freezes known as? [substance]	freezing point
Blood from what organs enters the left atrium of the heart? [organ]	lungs
The farther an area is from the equator, what happens to the temperature? [temperature]	it gets lower
What sort of issues can be determined by looking for certain particles in amniotic fluid? [fluid]	genetic disorders
The lunar landscape is covered by craters caused by what? [crater]	asteroid impacts
What is the name for the line dividing the earth's hemispheres? [earth]	equator
Dependent on the frequency of sound waves, what term described how high or low a sound seems to a listener? [sound]	pitch
Solar cells convert the energy in sunlight to what type of energy? [sunlight]	electrical energy
What occurs when a parent cell splits into two identical daughter cells of the same size? [split]	binary fission
A group of individuals that consists of genetically related individuals that can breed to produce fertile young is known as what? [individual]	species
What is the most dangerous type of radiation? [type]	gamma rays
What is the result when two monosaccharides are bound together? [result]	disaccharide
What are the two major atmospheric gases? [gas]	nitrogen and oxygen
What do you call the strands of dna wrapped around proteins, which are located inside the nucleus? [nucleus]	chromosomes

What is the most important muscle involved in the process of breathing? [process]	diaphragm
What is the basic characteristic of monoprotic bases? [characteristic]	accepts one proton
What do we call a device used to store electric charge? [charge]	capacitor

What traits are those that are inherited unchanged in a hybridization? [trait]	dominant traits

What body part does encephalitis attack? [body]	brain
What type of reproduction takes place when an animal simply divides into two parts? [place]	fission
Winds moving air masses causes what? [wind]	weather
How many orders of magnitudes bigger is the electric force? [order]	39
What is the term for any way that an animal interacts with other animals or the environment? [term]	animal behavior

What captures carbon dioxide as it is emitted by a power plant before it enters the atmosphere? [carbon]	carbon sequestration

What is the accumulated total of all the biochemical reactions occurring in a cell or organism called? [organism]	metabolism

What is extracted from rock by heap leaching, flotation, or smelting? [heap]	ore
What tool is useful for studying the ocean floor because the environment is remote and underwater? [tool]	sonar

Name two candidates for the original sources of viral genomes. [source]	plasmids and transposons
What do you call a substance that is not an acid or a base? [substance]	neutral

What type of physical properties of a substance do not depend on amount? [substance]	intensive

What type of roads and parking lots prevent rainwater from soaking into the ground? [road]	paved

Sucrose does not undergo reactions that are typical of aldehydes and ketones, therefore it is a nonreducing what? [reaction]	sugar
An electric stove changes electric current to what form of energy? [current]	thermal
Mammals are endothermic vertebrates that have four limbs and produce what type of eggs? [vertebrate]	amniotic
Which group of metals in the periodic table include elements such as sodium and potassium? [metal]	alkali metals
What is the term for force that opposes motion between any touching surfaces? [term]	friction
Most animals are in which clade? [clade]	bilateria
What system carries nerve impulses to internal organs, controlling activities that are not under your control, such as sweating and digesting food? [impulse]	autonomic nervous system
What are invertebrate chordates that retain all four defining chordate traits as adults called? [call]	lancelets
What has traditionally been defined as a force of attraction between two masses? [attraction]	gravity
What members of an ecosystem food chain take in food by eating producers or other living things? [producer]	consumers
What are small organelles and are the site of protein synthesis? [synthesis]	ribosomes
Lungs, pharynx, larynx, trachea, and bronchi are part of which system? [part]	respiratory
What is necessary for growth and energy? [growth]	nutrients
Bryophyta is the formal taxonomic name for the phylum that consists solely of what? [phylum]	mosses
In humans, how many chromosomes does each somatic cell have? [chromosome]	46
Like mitochondria, plastids contain their own what? [plastid]	dna
Terrestrial and aquatic are the two basic categories of what, on earth? [earth]	biomes
When dissolved in water, what do strong acids transfer to the solvent completely? [solvent]	acidic protons

What is one method to observe nebulae? [method]	telescope
When alternating primary current passes through coil p, it does what to the iron core? [current]	magnetizes it

What is the center of an earthquake called? [call]	the epicenter

How are the number of moles of carbon dioxide gas calculated? [carbon]	stoichiometry

Almost all plants make food through what process? [food]	photosynthesis

Initial substances are called reactants, and the final substances are called what? [substance]	products
What were the electrons initially called? [electron]	cathode rays
What is the type of energy that involves movement? [type]	mechanical energy
What do sharks use to secrete salt to assist in osmoregulation? [shark]	rectal gland
Why do viruses not belong to any domain of life? [domain]	they are nonliving
What is a change in the sequence of bases in dna or rna called? [sequence]	mutation
Metallic solids are composed entirely of which atoms? [atom]	metallic
What compound gives tarnished copper it's green color? [compound]	copper carbonate
As the population grows, competition for food does what? [food]	grows
What is the property by which water molecules stick together? [property]	cohesion
What is the main sex hormone in males called? [call]	testosterone
What is the name of the tube that joins the mouth to the digestive and respiratory tracts? [tube]	pharynx

Limestone is insoluble in water, so what can dissolve it? [can]	acid
Monatomic ions have an oxidation number equal to their what? [ion]	charge
Some flatworms are free-living carnivores that live mainly in which type of habitats? [type]	aquatic
Characterized by a short lifespan, what begin with production in the bone marrow under the influence of csfs and interleukins? [production]	leukocytes
What force is perpendicular to velocity and causes uniform circular motion? [uniform]	centripetal force
What are physical properties that do not depend on the substance present called? [present]	intensive properties
What does the secretion of the hormone cholecystokinin stimulate the release of? [secretion]	pancreatic juices, bile
What term is used to describe the electrostatic process used by most copy machines? [term]	xerography
Symptoms of viral diseases result from what kind of response to a virus? [response]	immune
The most common carbon atoms have six protons and six neutrons in their what? [proton]	nuclei
What type of organisms have internal clocks that regulate cyclic processes? [organism]	eukaryotic
How often does condensation occur in your cells? [condensation]	constantly
Overharvesting is a serious threat particularly to which species? [threat]	aquatic species
What are the cells that break down inorganic molecules to supply energy for the cell, and use carbon dioxide as a carbon source? [carbon]	chemoautotrophs
Each type of electromagnetic radiation has a characteristic range of wavelengths. the longer the wavelength (or the more stretched out it appears), the less energy is carried. short, tight waves carry what? [characteristic]	most energy
What are clouds on earth made of? [earth]	water vapor
What do extensive properties depend on the amount of? [property]	matter in a sample
What is the term for the rate at which velocity changes? [term]	acceleration
What determines which codon in the mrna the trna will bind to? [codon]	anticodon
What is the term for the complete set of genes and alleles within a population? [allele]	the gene pool

Oxygen and what are required for rust to form? [oxygen]	water
What is the process called in which a magnet loses its magnetic properties? [property]	demagnetization
The earliest animals were which kind of invertebrates? [animal]	aquatic
A lake is an example of what type of biome? [type]	freshwater biome
What kinds of waves are composed of various oscillating electric and magnetic fields? [field]	electromagnetic
When is the sun directly over the equator? [sun]	equinox
What does the base of a nucleotide within dna consist of? [nucleotide]	nitrogen
Which bones are flat and triangular and located at the back of the pectoral girdle? [bone]	scapulae
What always has the same elements in the same ratio? [element]	compound
Prior to ovulation, ovarian steroid hormones stimulate the uterus to prepare for support of what? [uterus]	embryo
All polar compounds contain what type of bonds? [compound]	polar
What often occurs on steep slopes in dry climates? [climate]	landslides
What kind of organisms have many different types of specialized cells with particular jobs? [particular]	multicellular
Part of the scientific process, these are statistical probabilities rather than certainties? [probability]	predictions
Ecology is a major branch of what higher-level "classification" of science? [classification]	biology
What is necessary for organisms to survive in the deepest parts of the ocean? [organism]	adaptations
What is the process of larva becoming an adult called? [process]	metamorphosis
Capillaries rejoin to form venules, which convey blood to what? [blood]	veins

What force holds planets in their orbits? [planet]	gravity
The nature of what gives metals the properties of being ductile and malleable? [metal]	metallic bonds
What are the special compartments that are surrounded by membranes inside eukaryotic cells called? [membrane]	organelles
Molds and casts usually form in which type of rock? [mold]	sedimentary
What is a hole that is dug or drilled through the ground down to an aquifer called? [hole]	well
When is a moving car said to be in dynamic equilibrium? [equilibrium]	zero net force
Every chemical reaction between molecules involves breaking and forming of what? [reaction]	bonds

Atomic orbitals are populated with what subatomic particles? [particle]	electrons
Which law refers to the electron charge remaining the same during transfer? [charge]	law of conservation of charge
Hotspots can be used to tell the speed and direction that what object is moving? [direction]	plates
Does overhead irrigation or drip irrigation use less water? [water]	drip irrigation
Stis are diseases caused by what that spread through sexual contact? [contact]	pathogens
The heart is a muscular organ that pumps blood through which system? [organ]	circulatory

What term is used to describe joints in which the bones are connected by cartilage? [term]	cartilaginous joints
What type of tissue is made up of cells that have the unique ability to contract? [tissue]	muscle tissue

What happens to the reaction rate over the course of a reaction? [reaction]	slows down

What consists of two or more elements and forms as a result of a chemical reaction? [element]	compound

What system in both males and females consists of structures that produce reproductive cells, or gametes, and secrete sex hormone? [hormone]	reproductive
What type of creature is noted for having its eyes at the tips of stalks or tentacles that emerge from its head? [head]	gastropods
What were the first animals to have true lungs and limbs for life on land? [animal]	amphibians
What do they call 2,2,4-trimethylpentane in the gasoline industry? [gasoline]	isooctane
What do we call any way that animals act, either alone or with other animals. [way]	animal behavior
When waves of two different frequencies interfere, what phenomenon occurs? [phenomenon]	beating
Further transformation occurs during organogenesis, the formation of what? [transformation]	organs
Each antibody can bind with just one specific type of what, resulting in a signal for a phagocyte to destroy them? [antibody]	antigen
What kind of surface temperature is found on venus? [temperature]	extremely high
What type of resource is limited in supply and cannot be replaced except over millions of years? [resource]	natural resource
The name of the cation comes first, followed by the name of the anion, in what kind of compound? [compound]	ionic compound

What are the cells or structures that detect sensations? [structure]	receptors
What artificial process involves making an exact copy of a gene? [copy]	gene cloning
Deer ticks are the vectors for what disease that affects humans? [vector]	lyme disease

What is the structure in a diploid sporophyte that undergoes meiosis to form haploid spores? [structure]	sporangium
Gene expression and what else are usually considered the same molecular process? [expression]	protein synthesis

In science, coefficients are used to balance what kind of equations? [kind]	chemical

What is transmitted that makes up the electromagnetic spectrum? [spectrum]	electromagnetic radiation in different wavelengths
Rust is an example of the reaction of oxygen with what? [oxygen]	iron

Where is the fruiting body normally produced in relation to the food source? [body]	at the surface

What term is used to describe the energy of matter in motion? [term]	kinetic energy

Herbivores and omnivores have longer alimentary canals compared to what? [omnivore]	carnivores
What do tadpoles turn into? [tadpole]	frogs
The heat capacity of an object depends on its chemical composition and what other property? [heat]	mass
Human skin color is primarily due to the presence of what pigment in the skin? [color]	melanin
What is pollution that enters water at just one point called? [call]	point source pollution
The various sensory organs are part of what organ system? [organ]	nervous
Down syndrome is caused by having three copies of what, a condition known as trisomy? [copy]	chromosome
What kind of weathering changes the size of a mineral or rock but does not change its chemical composition? [composition]	mechanical weathering
What do waves do when they are unable to pass through an object? [wave]	reflect off
What is used to date older fossils? [fossil]	radioactive isotopes
What external feature in human beings is responsible for balance? [human]	ears
What branch of science is the study of human origins? [branch]	paleoanthropology
Skeletal muscle cells and cardiac muscle cells share what property, which is not shared by smooth muscle cells? [property]	striations
Latitude affects the amount of what received by an area, which in turn affects the temperature of a region? [affect]	solar radiation
What do you call an abnormal mass formed when cells divide uncontrollably? [mass]	tumor
What layer is below the lithosphere and in the upper mantle? [layer]	asthenosphere
What are lipopolysaccharide components of the outer membrane of gram-negative bacteria? [component]	endotoxins
In aquatic communities, the main producers are photosynthetic protists and what? [producer]	prokaryotes
How does the liquid in a thermometer respond to heat or cold? [heat]	expands or contracts
In most fish, where does the embryo develop in relation to the mother's body? [body]	outside
What is the name of the life stage when a child becomes sexually mature? [stage]	puberty
Cytokinesis divides what part of the cell into two distinctive cells? [cytokinesis]	cytoplasm
What is it called when a liquid displays more attraction between the liquid particles than attraction between the liquid and the glass? [attraction]	cohesion
In what type of mining must tunnels be blasted into the rock so that miners and equipment can get to the ore? [miner]	underground mining
What kind of energy is released when the thermochemical reaction of a campfire converts wood to carbon dioxide and water? [campfire]	heat
Like the mitochondria, chloroplasts have their own dna and ribosomes, but chloroplasts have an entirely different function. chloroplasts are plant cell organelles that carry out what? [mitochondrion]	photosynthesis
While normal light microscopes can magnify objects up to about 1,500 times, what advanced instruments can magnify objects up to 1,000,000 times? [microscope]	electron microscopes
What kind of energy does pyruvate have a lot of? [lot]	chemical
What type of landscape has grasslands with scattered trees, are hot and have extensive dry seasons along with fire? [tree]	savannas
What may be lost when waves travel through matter, but not when they travel through space? [matter]	energy
Where does mechanical digestion begin? [digestion]	mouth
How does the sun generate energy? [sun]	nuclear fusion
What stored form of energy is made up of glycerol and three fatty acid chains? [chain]	triglycerides
What do jellyfish give off to startle possible predators? [predator]	light
What is an example of a metaloid element? [element]	silicon
Scientists use a quantity called __________ as a measure of disorder, or randomness. [quantity]	entropy
Niche refers to the role a species plays in what? [niche]	the ecosystem
An irreversible increase in size is known as? [size]	growth
Bacterial contamination of foods can lead to digestive problems, an illness known as what? [lead]	food poisoning
All combustion reactions are what type of reactions? [type]	exothermic
What produces microspores that develop into pollen grains containing male gametophytes? [gametophyte]	stamens
When a star's core collapses inward while the outer layers spread and cool, what "colorful" celestial body forms? [core]	red giant
Timber, obtained from trees that can be replanted to replace those that are cut down, is an example of what type of resource? [resource]	renewable
What type of blood does the right side of the heart collect and then pump to the lungs? [right]	oxygen-poor blood
What elements have the highest attraction for electrons? [attraction]	nonmetals
What is the layman's term for mammals raising their hair with tiny muscles in the skin, something that is automatic in humans sensing cold? [term]	goosebumps
What are ring-shaped hydrocarbons called? [shape]	cyclic hydrocarbons
What increases in processes in which solid or liquid reactants form gaseous products and when solid reactants form liquid products? [product]	entropy
How many pairs of legs do arachnids have? [pair]	4
Besides the uppermost mantle, what else is the lithosphere composed of? [mantle]	crust
What is another term for dry ice? [term]	solid carbon dioxide
Name the process that produces many copies of a certain gene. [copy]	gene cloning
Rupture or blockage of arteries in the head is the usual cause of what condition? [head]	stroke
What type of lines run next to each other? [type]	contour lines
What type of light sensing organs do scaophopoda have? [sense]	radula
What kind of cleavage do mammalian eggs exhibit? [cleavage]	holoblastic
What is the name of the process for delivering water to crops? [crop]	irrigation
What is the process in which a liquid boils and changes to a gas? [process]	vaporization
What are the two most common common ways that brain and spinal cord injuries occur? [way]	car crashes and athletic activities
What is the largest planet in the solar system? [planet]	jupiter
What are elements required in very small amounts? [element]	micronutrients
What can be calculated by multiplying an object’s mass in kilograms (kg) by its velocity in meters per second (m/s)? [kg]	momentum
What will happen to a rock when it's under tremendous stress? [stress]	it will fracture
Very large stars eventually become what extremely dense space regions, which are so dense that no light can escape from them? [light]	black holes
Which theory suggests plant species richness increases with island size? [island]	island equilibrium model
What state of hydrogen can be predicted based on the atoms to which it is bonded? [hydrogen]	oxidation
What occurs when there is little to no rain in a period of time? [rain]	droughts
At any specific time, the rate at which a reaction is proceeding is known as its what? [rate]	instantaneous rate
The skin is a familiar organ made of what kind of tissue? [tissue]	epithelial tissue
Evolution that occurs over a short period of time is known as what? [evolution]	microevolution
What do osteoblasts secrete that mineralizes to become bone matrix? [matrix]	collagen
Atoms that have gained electrons and become negatively charged are called what? [charge]	negative ions
Snakes are which type of animal? [snake]	carnivorous
Cancer occurs most often in adults over what age? [age]	fifty
Mammals are either herbivores, carnivores or what? [mammal]	omnivores

What is the process in which glucose is made using energy in light called? [light]	photosynthesis
What zone is outside the radiative zone? [zone]	convection zone
What do you call the temperature at which a liquid boils and starts changing to a gas? [temperature]	boiling point
The distinctive appearance of what tissue is due to polysaccharides called chondroitin sulfates? [tissue]	cartilage
In the humid subtropical climate, summers are ____ but winters are very cold. [climate]	wet

Light with the longest wavelengths is called what? [call]	infrared light
Which gas do people exhale during each breath? [breath]	carbon dioxide

What can be formed by converging light rays behind a lens, onto a piece of film? [piece]	a photograph
What is the star-like structure inside the paramecia? [star]	the contractile vacuole
What is the study of the chemical elements necessary for plant growth called? [call]	plant nutrition

What do you call the metal elements listed below the periodic table? [metal]	transition metals

What type of rocks form from sediments that are cemented and compacted? [rock]	sedimentary

What is the most common type of joint in the human body? [body]	movable joints

What do plants do to prevent water loss at night? [loss]	close their leaves

What evidence is there that mt. everest was once at the bottom of a sea? [sea]	fossils
Because atoms have equal numbers of positive protons and negative electrons, what kind of electric charge do they possess? [electron]	neutral

[variation]	periodic trends
