What type of gas is used to fill glass tubes of lighted signs? [light]	noble
What does fog consist of? [fog]	droplets of water
Spiders use the hydrostatic pressure generated by an open type of what anatomical system to extend their legs? [spider]	circulatory
The normal respiratory rate per minute in adult humans is? [rate]	12-18 breaths
Where is glycogen created and stored in the body? [body]	liver and muscles
When we neutralize a weak base with a strong acid, the product is ________ containing the conjugate acid of the weak base. [base]	salt
What is the main component of milk? [component]	water
Stomata are the main avenues of transpiration, the evaporative loss of water from what? [transpiration]	leaves
What is a form of matter that has a definite shape and volume? [shape]	solid
What type of energy is stored in the nuclei of atoms? [nucleus]	nuclear energy
Providing evidence of their ancestry, some species of what legless animals retain vestigial pelvic and limb bones? [animal]	snakes
What happens when more glucose is present than the proteins can handle, in the body? [body]	excreted as urine
What are most protist diseases in humans caused by? [disease]	protozoa
Transporting blood is the main job of the heart and what? [job]	blood vessels
What occurs when the amount of solute dissolved exceeds the solubility of the solute? [solute]	saturation
What do ferns use in place of seeds to reproduce? [place]	spores
Water affects the availability of what important element in aquatic environments and in flooded soils? [environment]	oxygen
Fuels according to the law of what, can never actually be “consumed”; it can only be changed from one form to another? [fuel]	conservation of energy
The ability of matter to burn is called? [matter]	flammability
Uncontrolled cell growth can lead to tumors and what disease? [tumor]	cancer
Video and audio signals are broadcast on these? [audio]	electromagnetic waves
In a tropical rainforest, where are ferns common? [rainforest]	understory
Which metalloids are found in the nitrogen group? [group]	arsenic and antimony
What kind of family is haumea part of? [family]	a collisional family
The db gene encodes the which receptor? [receptor]	leptin
How many main types of diabetes are there? [type]	two
What organ is similar to a lymph node but is much larger and filters blood instead of lymph? [lymph]	spleen
What is the process of converting atmospheric nitrogen to ammonia called? [call]	nitrogen fixation
Phospholipids and some proteins move laterally within what? [protein]	membrane
What changes encoded waves which are being broadcast into sounds? [sound]	radio receivers
When the oval window vibrates, it causes what else to vibrate as well? [oval]	the cochlea
When changes in the genes of a species result in a new species, the process is called what? [result]	biological evolution
What happens if a person doesn’t take in enough water to replace the water lost in sweat? [person]	dehydration
How does the atomic number change during beta emission? [emission]	increases by one
What is the most widely distributed organism around? [organism]	phages
On a topographic map, what is the term for a line of equal elevation? [term]	contour line
Where does the stratosphere get most of its heat? [heat]	sun

What is the name of pluto's moon? [s]	charon
What type of bond generally forms between a metal and non-metal? [metal]	ionic
What's the name for an atom that has gained or lost an electron? [electron]	an ion
Light is scattered from what in our atmosphere? [atmosphere]	molecules
What refers to the union of a male and female of the same species for reproduction? [union]	mating

Which theory states that the characteristics of living things are controlled by genes? [theory]	gene theory
What does the secondary oocyte have the most of from the original cell? [oocyte]	cytoplasm
Kangaroos, koala and opossums are part of what group? [group]	marsupials

What larger theory is einstein's equation part of? [s]	theory of relativity

What is the most complex organ in the human body? [body]	brain

What is another term for chemical messenger molecules? [term]	hormones

Which organisms capture light energy and convert it to chemical energy inside their cell? [light]	phototrophs

What are usually planted in rows with bare soil in between the rows? [soil]	crops
Name the type of system that a jellyfish does not have? [type]	circulatory

What term refers to the breaking stress that will cause permanent deformation or fracture of a material? [stress]	tensile strength

Plants can reproduce sexually and in which other way? [way]	asexually
Earth is the only planet in the solar system that has what element, which is essential for human life, present in all three of its states? [system]	water

[carbon]	stable

Of all the electromagnetic waves, which have the lowest frequencies? [wave]	radio waves
What do you call reversible changes that do not change matter’s chemical makeup or chemical properties? [call]	physical changes
Free atoms are spherical in shape, so the relative sizes of the elements can be compared by looking at each atom's atomic what? [atom]	radius
What types of energy is released during a chemical reaction? [energy]	heat, electricity, light
What is the most common type of organic compound? [compound]	carbohydrates
Hormones, ions, and neurotransmitters are all types of what? [ion]	chemical signals
What explains why water molecules tend to stick together? [stick]	hydrogen bonds
The maturing follicle, containing a fluid-filled cavity, enlarges, forming a bulge near the surface of what? [cavity]	the ovary
Storm surge is very high water located in the low pressure eye of what? [water]	hurricanes
What is a waste product from fossil fuel burning? [fossil]	co2 emissions
Carbon dioxide is an example of a material that easily undergoes what? [material]	sublimation
What is the term for daily cycles of behavior, like the sleep-wake cycle? [behavior]	circadian rhythms
What organ senses sound? [sense]	ear
The total energy assimilated by an ecosystem in a give period is known as what? [ecosystem]	gross primary production
Class bivalvia (“two shells”) includes clams, oysters, mussels, scallops, and these? [class]	geoducks
The mass lost in mass defect has gone into energy called what? [defect]	binding energy
What is used for the fermentation process that makes beer, wine, and bread? [wine]	yeast
Plant viruses can seriously disrupt crop growth and development, significantly affecting our what? [development]	food supply
In the past, biologists grouped living organisms into five kingdoms: animals, plants, fungi, protists, and what? [protist]	bacteria
What kind of joints allow for a wide range of flexibility? [range]	ball and socket
The human body wants to maintain equilibrium or balance, also known as what? [body]	homeostasis
Natural gas, such as those burned by gas stoves, is composed mostly of this? [stove]	methane
Which is the process through which leaves collect sunlight and make food? [sunlight]	photosynthesis
What model describes the structure of the plasma membrane as a mosaic of components? [mosaic]	fluid mosaic model
The hot liquid rock on the surface is called what? [rock]	lava
The first consumption of breast milk or formula floods the newborn’s sterile gastrointestinal tract with beneficial what? [breast]	bacteria
Clouds are formed from what? [cloud]	water droplets
After spermatids form, they move where to mature into sperm? [sperm]	into the epididymis
Matter can exist either as a pure substance or as a combination of what? [substance]	different substances
What is the separation of compounds on the basis of their solubilities in a given solvent? [basis]	fractional crystallization
Triploblasts include a broad range of animals, from flatworms to arthropods to what? [arthropod]	vertebrates
What is the release of particles and/or energy from the nucleus of an atom described as? [nucleus]	radioactivity
Through which process do behaviors that improve fitness increase? [behavior]	natural selection
Enzymes - proteins which speed up what? [enzyme]	chemical reactions
What do you call the sudden flow of mud down a slope because of gravity? [mud]	mudslide
What causes acid rain, ozone depletion, and global warming? [cause]	air pollution

What muscle in the chest helps inflate and deflate the lungs? [lung]	diaphragm
Where in the lungs does gas exchange between the air and blood takes place? [place]	alveoli
What are hollow cylinders and are the thickest of the cytoskeleton structures? [hollow]	microtubules
What simple sugar is the cell's primary source of energy? [source]	glucose
What is the approximate population on the earth? [earth]	7 billion
A change in the sequence of bases in dna or rna is called a what? [sequence]	mutation
What is the product of microfilament movement powered by chemical energy? [product]	muscle contraction
What is a measure of how much energy is needed to change the temperature of a substance? [substance]	specific heat
What is the common term for animals in the phylum porifera? [term]	sponges
What term is used to describe a change in the characteristics of living things over time? [term]	evolution
What can accept a wide range of carbohydrates for catabolism? [range]	glycolysis
What includes all living things within all their environments, including everywhere life exists, from the upper atmosphere, to the top of the soil, to ocean bottoms? [environment]	biosphere
What is unique and found in all living things because it can form up to four covalent bonds between atoms or molecules? [atom]	carbon
What kind of rock is gypsum? [rock]	sedimentary
What component of a prokaryote is unique in  molecular composition and mechanism of propulsion? [mechanism]	the flagella
The sum of the masses of the atoms in the formula is referred to as what? [formula]	molecular mass
What size of ring will a summer drought cause in a tree? [tree]	smaller
What is the technical term for species that produce their own body heat and regulate their internal temperature independently of the outside temperature? [temperature]	endothermic
What is the transparent outer covering of the eye? [covering]	cornea
Photoreceptors in each ocellus receive light only through the opening where there are none of which cells? [light]	pigmented
What helps form the walls of internal organs such as the heart and stomach? [wall]	muscles
How many valence electrons does helium have? [valence]	two
What is continuously changing within a circuit in an analog signal? [circuit]	voltage
What is made and stored primarily in the cells of the liver and muscles? [liver]	glycogen
Electromagnetic waves vary in wavelength and in what property, which is lower in waves of longer wavelengths? [property]	frequency
In the case of transverse waves, the movement of the medium is perpendicular to the direction of the what? [direction]	energy movement
Inserting an extra plane of atoms into a crystal lattice produces what? [crystal]	edge dislocation

Electric current is measured in coulombs per second, also called what? [second]	amperes

Unlike amphibians, reptiles do not have what stage? [stage]	larval
What basic plant structure can add support and anchorage? [structure]	roots

An atom is the smallest unit of what that maintains the identity of the latter? [identity]	element

[equivalent]	increase temperature

[deposition]	fat

Axons pass what on to other cells? [axon]	nerve impulses
Sister chromatids separate and move to opposite poles of the cell in the third phase of what process? [phase]	mitosis
What is the distance that sound waves travel in a given amount of time called? [sound]	speed of sound
What would you call a relationship where the bacteria benefit and and the other organism is harmed? [organism]	parasitism
What is the supply of water to land or crops to help growth called? [land]	irrigation
What form of matter has neither a definite shape nor a definite volume? [shape]	gas
Which stage has already been completed by the time sea urchin eggs are released from the female? [stage]	meiosis
Unlike pure substances, mixtures have a what? [substance]	variable composition
What process does not cause a rock to melt completely, instead causing the minerals to change by heat or pressure? [heat]	metamorphism
A disaccharide is a pair of monosaccharides. disaccharides are formed via dehydration synthesis, and the bond linking them is referred to as a glycosidic bond (glyco- = “sugar”). three disaccharides (shown in figure 2.19) are important to humans. these are sucrose, commonly referred to as table sugar; lactose, or milk sugar; and maltose, or this? [synthesis]	malt sugar
At what age is skeletal maturity reached by humans? [age]	20
What is most of earth's surface covered with? [earth]	water
What is the sac-like organ of the body that is important for both mechanical and chemical digestion? [body]	stomach
All chemical reactions require what to get started? [reaction]	activation energy
Mitosis is nuclear division during which duplicated chromosomes are segregated and distributed into what? [duplicate]	daughter nuclei
Movement of water and minerals in the xylem solutes, pressure, gravity, and matric potential are all important for what? [potential]	plant water transport
The temperature of the box is related to the average speed of what? [temperature]	molecules
What are organisms that eat just one type of food? [organism]	specialists
Mechanisms for establishing cellular asymmetries include morphogen gradients, localized determinants, and what other type of interactions? [interaction]	inductive
Biodiversity hot spots are prime candidates for protection because they are prone to what species fate? [protection]	extinction
What are single-celled or colonial organisms that do not have membranebound nuclei? [nucleus]	prokaryotes
Differences in density between water and air lead to differences in what? [difference]	pressure
What organizational tool, arguably the best in all of science, lists all the known chemical elements, arranged by atomic number? [tool]	periodic table
Solvation involves surrounding ions with what? [ion]	solvent particles
The appendicular skeleton includes all bones of the upper and lower limbs, plus the bones that attach each limb to the what? [limb]	axial skeleton

Cardiac muscle is only found where? [muscle]	heart
What process provides over 99 percent of the energy for life on earth? [percent]	photosynthesis

What causes rivers to always flow downhill? [river]	gravity
What elements do water and hydrogen peroxide consist of? [element]	hydrogen and oxygen
Name the virus that causes cold sores. [cause]	herpes virus

What is a dip slip fault where the dip of the fault plane is vertical? [slip]	strike-slip
The major entrance and exit for the respiratory system is which facial orifice? [system]	nose

What kind of reproduction involves just one parent and produces offspring genetically identical to each other and to the parent? [offspring]	asexual reproduction
What do you call the hard case that surrounds the soft parts of some animals? [call]	exoskeleton
Choosing to not smoke and using sunscreen are examples of lifestyle choices that help prevent forms of what disease? [example]	cancer
What is said about the speed of rotation in systems that create tornadoes? [rotation]	it is slow

What happens during the process of digestion? [process]	breakdown of food
What do you call the folded layers of rock where geologists look for oil? [layer]	anticlines

What is the alkaline hydrolysis reaction of an ester called? [call]	saponification
What is the time interval required for one complete wave to pass a point called? [wave]	period
Plant-like protists are autotrophs, meaning they make their own what? [protist]	food

What forces the fetus out of the uterus? [fetus]	continuous strong contractions

What do you call the transfer of thermal energy? [call]	heat
The outer layer of what anatomical structure is so tough that it keeps out most pathogens? [layer]	skin

[electrolyte]	osmotic balance

What connects the peripheral nervous system to the central nervous system? [system]	nerves
In which supergroup are red algae and green algae included? [algae]	archaeplastida
If a machine only changes the direction of a force without changing the ratio of the output/input forces, then what is its associated mechanical advantage? [advantage]	1
What is an advantage of brightly colored fruits? [advantage]	attract animals to disperse their seeds
What is the apt term for the very slow movement of rock and soil down a hillside? [term]	creep
The zeros at the end of a number are known as what? [zero]	trailing zeros
Does water get colder or warmer the deeper you go? [water]	colder
Many transition metals and their compounds are used as what? [compound]	catalysts
What do willow trees produce to kill bacteria? [tree]	salicylic acid
What do decomposers release once they have broken down the dead organisms? [organism]	inorganic molecules
Often determining the strength or intensity of a wave, this term is the distance from the equilibrium point of motion to either its lowest or highest point? [term]	amplitude
Which type of muscle fiber can sustain long contractions? [muscle]	slow fibers
We would genetically be all the same if genes did not have different what? [gene]	alleles

What is the name for a way of learning that involves reward or punishment? [way]	conditioning
What scale measures the total energy released by an earthquake? [scale]	moment magnitude scale
All enzymes have an optimal temperature and what? [temperature]	ph
When do homologous chromosomes form pairs? [pair]	meiosis
What forms when the metal sodium gives up an electron to the nonmetal chlorine? [metal]	an ionic bond
What type of gas is produced by alcoholic fermentation of the glucose in corn or other plants? [plant]	ethanol
What type of transport is vesicle transport considered to be? [vesicle]	active transport
Strong bands of dense, regular connective tissue that connect muscles to bones are called what? [tissue]	tendons
Homes and transportation use what percent of all energy in the u.s.? [home]	half (fifty)
What falls roughly in the middle of the electromagnetic spectrum, having shorter wavelengths and higher frequencies than microwaves, but not as short and high as x rays? [spectrum]	light
Explanations of some aspect of the natural world based on repeated observations are termed what? [term]	scientific theories
What is found in abundance in the polar ice caps and under the surface of mars? [ice]	water
What do nerve impulses travel along? [nerve]	axons
Cyanobacteria are bluish green in color because they contain what? [color]	chlorophyll
How many miles is the distance between the earth and sun? [earth]	93

What is the largest mammal on earth? [earth]	blue whale
What are elements that generally do not conduct electricity? [element]	nonmetals
Superconductors expel a magnetic field from their interior. what is this phenomenon known as? [field]	meissner effect
Continually increasing the pressure on the liquid will eventually cause the substance to do what? [cause]	solidify
Hypersensitivity may refer to a maladaptive response of what system toward a harmless foreign substance? [substance]	immune
Similarity that results from common ancestry is known as what? [similarity]	homology
We all start as a single cell and soon grow into what? [single]	embryo
Which acid contains only one ionizable hydrogen? [hydrogen]	monoprotic acid

What is a double membrane of the nucleus that encloses the genetic material? [membrane]	nuclear enevelope
What effect does changing temperature have on a system at equilibrium? [temperature]	stress
What type of cancer can the use of tanning beds lead to? [lead]	skin cancer
Organisms tend to be larger in size at higher what levels? [organism]	trophic
A major step in animal evolution was the evolution of what rigid rod that runs the length of the body? [evolution]	notochord
What is the name of the process that refers to the balance or equilibrium within the cell or a body? [cell]	homeostasis
What is the clear, protective covering on the outside of the eye? [covering]	cornea
Deeper layers of rock must be older than layers closer to the surface, this is the law of what? [layer]	superposition

Which infection turns ant's abdomen red and fruit-like and an easy prey for birds? [infection]	neotropicum
What do mitochondrions have an inner and outer version of? [version]	membrane

What expresses the mass of substance in terms of the volume occupied by the substance? [substance]	density
What organ is the hypothalamus a part of? [hypothalamus]	brain
Urea, ammonia and uric acid are types of what waste, excreted in different forms by different species? [type]	nitrogenous waste

What is transmitted by moving electrons in an electric current? [electron]	electrical energy
What happens if a molecule forms strong bonds to the catalyst? [bond]	catalyst gets poisoned

Where are the terrestrial planets located, in relation to the sun? [sun]	closest
What are the insects that suck up the sap from plants? [plant]	aphids and leafhoppers
The energy for an ecosystem can come from sunlight or _________? [sunlight]	chemical compounds
Phagocytosis, pinocytosis, and receptor-mediated endocytosis are the three types of what? [pinocytosis]	endocytosis
What type of machines generally have lower efficiency but greater mechanical advantage? [advantage]	compound machines
What is the name of the layer above the mesosphere? [layer]	thermosphere
What layer of earth contains abundant oxygen, which can combine with other elements to create oxide minerals? [oxide]	the crust
Animals that are endotherms or ectotherms are distinguished by the ability to maintain a constant what? [ectotherm]	body temperature
What form of energy is light? [light]	electromagnetic
What is a common chemical substance on planet earth? [earth]	water
Blood calcium levels are tightly regulated by the what system? [calcium]	endocrine
This bodily defense function attacks pathogens and includes inflammatory response and phagocytosis? [response]	second line of defense
Lodgepole cones remain closed until exposed to what? [cone]	extreme heat
What is the change of state from a gas to a liquid? [state]	condensation
The steropodon may have been an ancestor of which animal? [may]	platypus
Closely associated with "work", what is characterized by its many forms and the fact that it is conserved? [fact]	energy
What is the time it takes for radioactive substance to decay? [decay]	half-life
What type of biomes are found in the salt water of the ocean? [type]	marine
What is formed when an enzyme binds its substrate? [substrate]	enzyme - substrate complex
What type of rock is a sandstone? [rock]	sedimentary rocks
Which acids provide the molecular blueprints for all proteins produced in living systems? [protein]	nucleic acids
Cephalopods have three hearts that pump blood of what color? [blood]	blue
Influenza is a type of what, where glycoproteins attach to a host epithelial cell? [host]	viral disease
What is the smallest aromatic hydrocarbon? [hydrocarbon]	benzene
A hypothesis is scientific only if it can be tested by what? [test]	making observations
Aging occurs as cells lose their ability to do what? [age]	divide
The tyndall effect refers to the scattering of what by colloidal particles? [particle]	visible light
Acids are associated with a low number on which scale? [scale]	ph
Said to go hand-in-hand with science, what evolves as new materials, designs, and processes are invented? [design]	technology
What are the poles labeled? [pole]	north and south
What is considered to be the "fundamental unit" of life? [unit]	cell
What two states of matter are included in the category "fluids"? [matter]	liquids and gases
When matter changes into an entirely different substance with different chemical properties, what has occurred? [substance]	chemical change
Phospholipids are unable to mix with what? [phospholipid]	water
What are molecules that the immune system recognize as foreign to the body? [body]	antigens
The end result of diffusion is an equal concentration, or equilibrium , of molecules on both sides of what? [result]	the membrane
What paired organs that are part of the urinary system play the prime role in excretion? [part]	kidneys
The fungus benefits from the constant supply of food produced by what? [benefit]	the photosynthesizer
Gases can be classifed as real or what? [gas]	ideal
What is a mutation? [mutation]	change in the nucleotide sequence of dna
What are biological catalysts that speeds up biochemical reactions? [reaction]	enzymes
What type of reaction is a transfer of a proton from one molecule or ion to another? [proton]	acid-base
What part of the plant, in general, is responsible for transport and storage of water and minerals? [part]	stems
One gram of carbohydrates provides how many calories of energy? [gram]	four
Mushrooms and other fungi obtain energy from what? [fungus]	other organisms
How are protozoa that cause giardiasis spread? [cause]	food and water
What can prevent the passage of molecules and ions between cells, such as in the blood-brain barrier? [brain]	tight junctions
Give an example of air pollution while painting indoors. [pollution]	paint fumes
What plays a variety of important roles in biochemical systems? [system]	protein
What type of plants grow on other plants? [type]	epiphytes
What provides a protective covering for the body and helps maintain homeostasis? [homeostasis]	integumentary system
Uranium is an important part of the process used to harness which type of power? [part]	nuclear
Budding and fission in annelids are examples of what type of reproduction? [type]	asexual
What is the process by which plants make their own food? [food]	photosynthesis
In what part of the carbon cycle does carbon move between living things and the air? [part]	biotic cycle
Herbivores and the bacteria that live in their intestines demonstrate a two-way beneficial relationship called what? [way]	mutualism
What joins within each testis to form the epididymis? [testis]	seminiferous tubules
How many layers of phospholipids does the cell membrane contain? [layer]	two
What process within cells makes sure that every gamete receives a copy of every chromosome? [chromosome]	meiosis
Do amphibians and reptiles maintain a constant body temperature? [temperature]	no, they have about the same body temperature as their surroundings
Most vascular plants are seed plants, also known as? [plant]	spermatophytes
Centrifuges use what to perform their task? [task]	inertia
What are the two unique features of mollusks? [mollusk]	mantle and radula
Name the two types of water turtles live in. [type]	ocean water and fresh water
What structures are located on roof of the nasopharynx and on each side of the pharynx? [pharynx]	tonsils
What colorful arc-shaped atmospheric phenomena are produced by a combination of refraction and reflection? [combination]	rainbows
Rabies transmission occurs when saliva from an infected mammal enters a wound. the virus travels through neurons in the peripheral nervous system to the central nervous system where it impairs this? [transmission]	brain function
Newton realized that the nature of gravity on earth that pulls an apple to the ground could explain the motion of these? [nature]	moon and planets
Where do most of the steps of cellular respiration take place? [place]	mitochondria
Which metal is not solid at room temperature? [temperature]	mercury
Induced mutations are caused by environmental factors. what term is used to describe a mutation that has no environmental cause? [term]	spontaneous mutation
What part of the cell does cellular respiration occur? [respiration]	mitochondria
How is the chance of survival affected when animals lack parental care? [survival]	decreased
Elements with magic numbers of what tend to have more stable isotopes? [stable]	protons
What is the term for the steep sloped side of a sand dune? [term]	slip face
Pulleys are generally used to do what with objects? [pulley]	lift
What term describes how close estimates are to one another? [term]	precision
What are membrane-bound organelles that can have secretory, excretory, and storage functions? [organelle]	vacuoles
The structural classification of joints divides them into bony, fibrous, cartilaginous, and synovial joints. the bones of fibrous joints are held together by fibrous connective tissue; the three types of fibrous joints are sutures, syndesomes, and what? [tissue]	gomphoses
A catalyst can increase the rate of what, in general? [rate]	chemical reaction
Which crust lies deep inside the ocean? [ocean]	oldest
What is the most significant cause of respiratory disease as well as cardiovascular disease and cancer? [disease]	smoking
What type of light can you feel as heat but not see and has the longest wavelengths and lowest frequencies? [heat]	infrared light
Ionic, molecular, covalent, and metallic are major types of what state of matter? [matter]	solids
What forces keep the moon orbiting the earth? [earth]	gravitational
Snow and ice may also undergo which process where there is intense sunlight, very cold temperatures, and dry winds? [snow]	sublimation
Electromagnets can be controlled by controlling what type of current? [type]	electric
The rate of evolution is influenced by the rate of changes to what? [evolution]	the environment
What do you call a device that produces a very focused beam of visible light of just one wavelength and color? [device]	laser
Bubbles in bread dough are created by what gas produced during alcoholic fermentation? [dough]	carbon dioxide
What is the capacity to cause change? [capacity]	energy
Ocean currents transfer heat from the equator towards what locations? [heat]	poles
In sexual reproduction, two of what unite to produce an offspring? [offspring]	gametes
What are the ends of long bones called? [call]	epiphysis
Convection is the transfer of thermal energy by particles moving through what? [convection]	fluid
What happens when waves reach the shore? [shore]	topple and break
What is an involuntary muscle contraction that moves rapidly along an organ like a wave called? [muscle]	peristalsis
What is the purpose of water molds in fresh water environments? [mold]	decomposition
What corrosive substances capable of dissolving many metals can cause contamination if spilled? [metal]	acids
What is always conserved in chemical reactions? [reaction]	mass
A polyatomic ion is an ion composed of more than one what? [ion]	atom
Mutualism is an interaction between individuals of two different species that has what effect on both of them? [individual]	beneficial
What are the structural and functional units of the nervous system, which transmit nerve impulses to other cells? [unit]	neurons
If hot water becomes trapped, pressure may build up. when the water breaks free, it creates what? [may]	geyser
What electrical force is responsible for fission? [fission]	repulsion
Which law states that a pair of alleles is separated, or segregated, during the formation of gametes? [allele]	law of segregation
Sounds or pictures can be encoded in pulses of what, which are then sent through an optical fiber? [sound]	laser light
What substance are physical objects are made of? [substance]	matter
Why do mangrove trees rise high above the water? which characteristic help them to do so? [characteristic]	stilt like roots
What fertilizes an egg during sexual reproduction? [reproduction]	sperm
How does the fungus benefit from the photosynthesizer? [benefit]	supply of food
What is the name for unsaturated hydrocarbons that contain at least one double bond? [bond]	alkenes

During what period on earth was coal formed? [earth]	the carboniferous period
What is the term for the visible part of the electromagnetic spectrum? [term]	light
Which vertebrates were the first with four limbs? [limb]	amphibians (or tetrapods)
How do plants support themselves above the ground to get light and oxygen? [oxygen]	stiff stems
What process starts with glucose and ends with two pyruvate molecules, a total of four atp molecules and two molecules of nadh? [glucose]	glycolysis

What is the age-related disorder that causes the gradual loss of bone density and strength? [density]	osteoporosis
Which bones are the large, curved bones that form the lateral and anterior aspects of the pelvis? [bone]	hip
What bifurcates into the right and left bronchi in the lungs? [lung]	trachea
What is the spreading of white light into its full spectrum of wavelengths called? [wavelength]	dispersion
What type of fertilization usually occurs in aquatic environments where both eggs and sperm are released into the water? [environment]	external
What is the energy of motion called? [call]	kinetic energy
Overharvesting is especially challenging for species with what type of habitat? [type]	restricted
What is a representation of the valence electrons of an atom that uses dots around the symbol of the element? [valence]	lewis structure

The simplest example of what type of 'organ system' is the gastrovascular cavity found in organisms with only one opening for the process? [example]	digestive
Photographs of the heat emitted by an object are called what? [heat]	thermal images
Graphite is a form of elemental carbon what is another form? [carbon]	diamond
If everything else stays the same in a system with a gas in it, and the gas gets warmer, what will happen to its pressure, generally? [will]	it increases

[metabolism]	hydrogen peroxide

What is defined as the velocity of the object at a given moment? [moment]	instantaneous velocity
What is the term for an expression showing the relationship of the reaction rate to the concentrations of each reactant? [term]	rate law
How many pi bonds are found in a triple bond? [bond]	two
What is formed when an acidic solution and a basic solution react together in a neutralization reaction? [reaction]	salt
What is the causative agent of sleeping sickness in humans? [sickness]	trypanosoma brucei

What cellular structure is used during endocytosis to allow molecules to enter the cell? [structure]	vesicles
What are unique about prokaryotic cells' organelles? [organelle]	not membrane-bound
How long ago did the ancestors of mammals evolve? [mammal]	300 million years

Pharmacist and surveyor are two career options based in what type of science? [surveyor]	physical
What is another term for foodborne illness? [term]	food poisoning
The mechanical advantage of a machine is related to how it changes what? [advantage]	force
What term in physics refers to the use of force to move an object? [term]	work

What kind of energy used heat from magma within the earth to heat homes or produce steam that turns turbines? [heat]	geothermal energy

The central nervous system is composed of the brain and what else? [brain]	the spinal cord
A group of genetically identical individuals is called what? [individual]	a clone
Where on the earth's surface does the water cycle takes place? [place]	on, above, and below
Under which conditions do many bacteria carry out alcohol fermentation? [alcohol]	anaerobic
Fermat's principle states that what will always take the path that takes the least amount of time? [time]	light

What level is greater than 7 in a basic solution? [solution]	ph

What does an array of radio telescopes collect? [radio]	radio waves
What kind of compounds contain positively and negatively charged ions in a ratio that results in an overall charge of zero? [result]	ionic compounds

Carbon atoms have six neutrons as well as how many protons? [proton]	six

What type of cell contains a nucleus? [nucleus]	eukaryotic cell

The vector of what organism is significant on a map showing the location of malaria? [location]	mosquito
What is the smallest particle of an element that still has the properties of that element is called? [property]	atom
What is already causing food and water shortages and species extinctions? [cause]	global warming
What is the foundation species of coral reef ecosystems? [ecosystem]	coral
When the ph of precipitation is lowered because of air pollution, what results? [precipitation]	acid rain
What type of barrier physically blocks pathogens from entering the body? [body]	mechanical
In what do a roundworm's eggs pass from host to the environment? [roundworm]	feces
What is the name of the command center of the cell? [command]	nucleus
What is the only natural phenomenon that causes more damage than earthquakes? [damage]	hurricanes
What is the hypothesis that states that the biosphere is its own living organism? [biosphere]	gaia hypothesis
The kinetic energy of molecules is generally proportionate to what other property that they have? [property]	temperature
Several neuropeptides, relatively short chains of amino acids, serve as neurotransmitters that operate via metabotropic what? [neurotransmitter]	receptors
What kind of process is boiling? [process]	isothermal
In science, what is constantly tested, sometimes revised, sometimes thrown out and sometimes well-established? [test]	a theory
What is the name of the process in which both the system and its environment can return to exactly the states they were in by following the reverse path? [environment]	reversible process
What must be present on a plant where ladybugs will lay their eggs? [will]	aphids

A solute generally has what effect on the boiling point of a solvent? [solvent]	raises
What type of climates are found around the equator? [climate]	tropical
What kind of planet do we consider ceres to be? [planet]	dwarf planet
How many pairs of legs does a millipede have per body segment? [segment]	two
What is the fertilization step in the sexual reproduction of plants? [reproduction]	pollination
How do you add two dimensional vectors? [vector]	geometrically
The fact that all living things share the same biochemical building blocks is molecular evidence of what theorized process? [fact]	evolution
What is a copy of an object that is formed by reflected light? [copy]	image
Hypoxia is a condition of the reduced supply of what? [condition]	oxygen
What part of an atom is positive due to the presence of positively charged protons? [part]	nucleus

What are the major types anchoring proteins? [type]	claudins and occludins

What do a river and all its tributaries make up? [river]	river system
What structure is the site of all of the basic biochemical processes that keep organisms alive? [organism]	cell
How does the magnetic field produced by a current in a wire move? [field]	in concentric circles

When do alkane reactions usually occur? [reaction]	under extreme conditions

What population on earth is already harming the environment due to less resources to go around? [earth]	humans

In the nematic phase, only the long axes of the molecules are parallel, and the ends are staggered at random intervals. in the smectic phase, the long axes of the molecules are parallel, and the molecules are also arranged in planes. finally, in thecholesteric phase, the molecules are arranged in layers; each layer is rotated with respect to the ones above and below it to give it this? [phase]	spiral structure

What is a renewable resource that can take thousand of years to form? [resource]	soil

What is the term for when two opposing processes reach the same speed, resulting in no overall change? [speed]	equilibrium
What term describes the number and kinds of species in a location or on the planet? [term]	biodiversity
What energy is stored in a person or object? [person]	potential energy
What do we call a peptide hormone composed of nine amino acids that lowers blood pressure? [hormone]	bradykinin
Which lymphoid organ is situated in the upper chest? [chest]	thymus
What is calculated by subtracting the smallest value from the largest value? [value]	the range
Birds actually have two basic types of feathers: flight feathers and? [bird]	down feathers
What is the name for the process of charging an object by touching it with another charged object? [charge]	charging by conduction
Labor is the muscular contractions to expel the fetus and placenta from where? [fetus]	uterus
What are topographic maps that show water depths called? [depth]	bathymetric maps
Energy transferred solely due to a temperature difference is called? [temperature]	heat
In which organ does a baby develop? [baby]	uterus
What part of an experiment or other investigation consists of the individuals or events that are studied? [part]	sample
The intentional release or spread of agents of disease is known as what? [disease]	bioterrorism
If pressure is exerted on the rock from one direction, the rock forms layers. this is called what? [direction]	foliation
What term is used to describe the average weather of a place over many years? [term]	climate
A long chain of monosaccharides linked by glycosidic bonds is known as what? [monosaccharide]	polysaccharide
How do genes located on separate nonhomologous chromosomes sort? [gene]	independently
What type of mass movement is a sudden movement of large blocks of rock and soil down a slope? [soil]	slump
What consists of structures that produce eggs and secrete female sex hormones? [sex]	female reproductive system
Lactic acid fermentation is common in muscle cells that have run out of what? [fermentation]	oxygen
How many sets of chromosomes does each somatic cell have? [chromosome]	two
Nonflowering vascular plants have three basic types of leaves: microphylls, fronds, and what other type? [type]	needles
What is the most common plant-like protist? [protist]	unicellular algae
What biochemicals mediate changes in target cells by binding to specific receptors? [receptor]	hormones
New land can be created when what happens to a volcano? [volcano]	it erupts
To calculate acceleration without a change in direction, you just divide the change in velocity by the change in what? [velocity]	time
What is reduced and forms part of the gelatinous disks sandwiched between the vertebrae in humans? [sandwich]	the notochord
What type of relationship is parasitism? [type]	symbiotic relationship
What two things are used in optical instruments to reflect or refract light? [thing]	mirrors and lenses
What physical property of matter reflects how closely packed the particles of matter are? [matter]	density
What type of boiling point do nonmetals normally have? [type]	low
Coxal glands collect liquid waste from what? [liquid]	blood
The main organs of the cardiovascular system are the blood vessels and what else? [vessel]	heart
What substance flows over the land from precipitation or melting snow or ice? [snow]	water
Most turtle bodies are covered by a special bony or cartilaginous shell developed from their what? [body]	ribs
What device uses an electromagnet to change electrical energy to kinetic energy? [electromagnet]	electric motor
What causes the particles of medium to move parallel to the direction of the wave? [direction]	longitudinal waves
Which state of matter lacks a fixed volume, fixed shape, and consists of charged particles? [particle]	ions
What type of cell transmits electrical impulses in the nervous system? [type]	nerve cell
What is the force pushing a rocket called? [rocket]	thrust
In headwater streams, what plant process is mostly attributed to algae that are growing on rocks? [attribute]	photosynthesis
What is the term that refers to stored chemical energy in organic matter or wastes? [term]	biomass energy
The process of photosynthesis ultimately gets powered by what kind of energy? [kind]	light
A binary molecular compound is a molecular compound that is composed of what? [compound]	two elements
Within the first 8 weeks of gestation, a developing embryo establishes the rudimentary structures of all of its organs and tissues from the ectoderm, mesoderm, and endoderm. this process is called what? [tissue]	organogenesis
What goes through different larval stages? [stage]	crustaceans
What is the major cause of chronic respiratory disease as well as cardiovascular disease and cancer? [disease]	smoking
Monotremes, marsupials, and placental mammals are subclasses of what? [subclass]	mammals
What type of mammal gives birth to young that need to develop further in the mother's pouch after birth? [mammal]	marsupials
What is the measure of how closely molecules are packed together? [pack]	density
What is the leading cause of lung cancer? [lung]	tobacco smoke
The golgi removes some sugar monomers and substitutes others, producing a large variety of what? [variety]	carbohydrates
Parenchymal, collenchymal, and sclerenchymal cells are associated with what types of living things? [thing]	plants
What is the name of the location in which a stream or river starts? [river]	source
What disease occurs when cells in the breast grow out of control and form a tumor? [tumor]	breast cancer
What process refers to the changes that occur in populations of living organisms over time? [organism]	evolution
Alkenes can react with what to form alcohols? [alcohol]	water
Wind blown sand contributes to what type of erosion? [sand]	abrasion
Bases are ionic compounds consisting of hydroxide ions and a what? [compound]	cation
What causes the menstrual cycle to be repeated? [cycle]	lack of fertilization
What happens when turgid cells in a nonwoody tissue push against each other? [tissue]	the tissue stiffens
What is the waxy substance that epidermal cells secrete? [substance]	cuticle
What is the length of the route between two points? [route]	distance
According to the first law of thermodynamics, what can neither be created nor destroyed? [law]	energy
What are the three primary pigment colors? [color]	cyan, yellow, magenta
How do organophostbate pesticides work? [pesticide]	inhibiting acetylcholinesterase
In the case of a light bulb, electricity is converted to light and what kind of energy? [bulb]	thermal
Where in relation to the home, are levels of vocs found to be higher? [home]	indoors
Density and pressure of air decreases with what? [density]	altitude
Energy is absorbed in the process of converting a liquid at its boiling point into a what? [liquid]	gas
Images in what type of mirror are reversed left and right but not reversed top and bottom? [image]	plane mirror
What do cells produce as they age? [age]	proto-oncogenes
The body of the simplest sponges takes the shape of a cylinder with a large central cavity, called? [cylinder]	spongocoel
Laid on dry land by reptiles, amniotic eggs have what that prevents them from drying out? [reptile]	waterproof membranes
What three rs represent the steps that you personally can take to conserve our natural resources and minimize waste? [resource]	reduce, reuse, recycle
What is the process that allows organisms with better traits to survive and produce? [organism]	natural selection
What is the term for a substance that increases the rate of a chemical reaction but is not changed or used up in the reaction? [term]	a catalyst
What type of compounds can form crystals? [compound]	ionic compounds
In grazing, a predator partially eats but does not kill what? [predator]	prey
Bone tissues include compact bone, spongy bone, bone marrow, and? [tissue]	periosteum
What type of bacteria causes the disease called tuberculosis? [cause]	mycobacterium
Studies have shown that not only does reproduction have a cost as far as how long male fruit flies live, but also fruit flies that have already mated several times have limited amounts of this? [reproduction]	sperm
What are the two most common causes of diseases? [disease]	bacteria and viruses
Organic compounds are defined as covalently bonded compounds containing carbon, excluding carbonates and what else? [compound]	oxides
What drives the turbine in a thermonuclear reactor? [turbine]	heated water or steam
What is the term for physicians and scientists who research and develop vaccines and treat and study conditions ranging from allergies to aids? [term]	immunologists
Where are temperatures the lowest? [temperature]	at the poles
Protecting the surface of metal prevents what? [metal]	corrosion
What type of tissues are major barriers to the entry of pathogens into the body? [tissue]	mucosal
Trash that gets into fresh and saltwater waterways is called what type of debris? [saltwater]	aquatic
What is the term for genes that control the expression of other genes within specific regions of cells in the developing organism? [term]	gap genes
In vertebrates, what tissue is a type of connective tissue that supports the entire body structure? [tissue]	bone
Red blood cells don't have a nucleus. this allows them to do what? [nucleus]	carry more oxygen
The number of electron pairs that hold two atoms together is called? [electron]	bond order
What occurs when the immune system makes an inflammatory response to a harmless antigen? [response]	allergies
What energy source, now making a comeback, has helped propel ships and pump water for many years? [source]	wind energy
What is it called when the nucleus of an atom splits into two smaller nuclei? [split]	nuclear fission
The curie (ci) is one measure of the rate of what? [rate]	decay
A unique type of organism is also known as what? [organism]	species
Snakes use what anatomical structure to smell scents in the air? [scent]	forked tongue
What chemical element helps forms strong bones and teeth in humans? [tooth]	calcium
The limit to how much solute will dissolve in a given amount of solvent is called what? [solvent]	solubility
What occurs when hot magma transforms rock that it contacts? [contact]	contact metamorphism
What term refers to entities, events or powers regarded as being beyond nature, and cannot be explained by scientific means? [term]	supernatural
What causes an elastic force in springs? [spring]	stretching or compressing
What effect is responsible for flight paths looking curved? [curve]	coriolis effect
Wetlands are environments in which the soil is either permanently or periodically saturated with what? [soil]	water
When the ground absorbs the water and it settles below the surface it is called what? [call]	groundwater
Some metabolic pathways release what by breaking down complex molecules to simpler compounds? [compound]	energy
What is the smallest portion of a crystal lattice? [portion]	unit cell
What is one major cause of skin cancer? [cause]	ultraviolet light
Which important decomposers are known to live just about anywhere on earth? [earth]	archeans
In the scientific method, what is the initial, unproven explanation for why something is occurring? [something]	hypothesis
What is the name of an element with a different number of neutrons? [element]	isotope
Nitrogen and sulfur oxides form what type of rain? [sulfur]	acid rain
Polyester fabric's resistance to wrinkling comes from the cross-linking of what? [s]	polymer strands
What term refers to the sequence of community and ecosystem changes after a disturbance? [term]	ecological succession
What is the network of fibers that organizes structures and activities in the cell called? [call]	cytoskeleton
Decreasing the volume of a gas and keeping everything else the same will cause its pressure to change in what way? [way]	increase
What evolutionary strategy enables substantial activity during sleep for some animals? [animal]	adaptation
The cells of the blastocyst form an inner cell mass called the what? [blastocyst]	embryoblast
How do all musical instruments create sound? [sound]	vibration
What system disorders include kidney stones, kidney failure, and urinary tract infections? [infection]	urinary system
What type of respiration has the advantage of releasing more energy? [advantage]	aerobic
Major climate types are based on what two things? [climate]	temperature & precipitation
When amino acids bind together, they form a long chain called what, which is an essential component of protein? [call]	polypeptide
What type of cells does meiosis produce? [type]	haploid daughter cells
Organisms that lack both a nucleus and membrane-bound organelles are known as what, in general? [nucleus]	prokaryotic
What happens to most of the energy in a trophic level as it passes to the next higher level? [level]	it is lost
What is the name for a specific amount of solute that can dissolve in a given amount of solvent? [can]	solubility
What is freshwater below the earth's surface called? [earth]	groundwater
What forms when crystals precipitate out from a liquid? [liquid]	chemical sedimentary rocks
What do people build to protect areas from floods? [people]	dams
What system of the body is responsible for ultimately ridding it of waste and excess water? [body]	excretory system
What's it called when there's a sudden flow of mud? [call]	mudflow
Which zone is located below 200 meters from the surface? [zone]	aphotic zone
Food chewed evenly during mastication moisten and lubricate the lining of the mouth and this? [lining]	pharynx
Photosynthesis is initiated by what hitting plants? [photosynthesis]	sunlight
What is the process of drawing general conclusions based on many pieces of evidence? [piece]	inductive reasoning
Name the fibrous joint in which two parallel bones are united to each other by fibrous connective tissue. [tissue]	syndesmosis
What's the best way humans can conserve water? [way]	use less
Although fewer in number than chemical synapses, what type of synapses are found in all nervous systems and play important and unique roles? [system]	electrical synapses
What consists of a nitrogen atom bonded to some combination of carbons and hydrogens? [carbon]	an amine
When do hammerhead sharks usually hunt? [shark]	at night
What types of glands do only female mammals have? [type]	mammary
What is the unit used to measure air pressure? [unit]	millibar
In which stage does the chromatin condense into chromosomes? [stage]	prophase ii
What is the upper-most atmosphere known as? [atmosphere]	thermosphere
Reproduction that doesn't involve a male gamete is also known as what? [reproduction]	agamogenesis
What is the term for an electronic component that consists of many other electronic components? [component]	integrated circuit
What is another term for life science? [term]	biology
What type of cartilage contains no collagen? [type]	lamprey cartilage
In prokaryotes, what are the regions called that repressors bind to? [region]	operators
What instrument has a resolution many times greater than a light microscope, and can be used to see the details on the outside of a cell? [microscope]	electron microscope
The temperature at which the individual ions have enough kinetic energy to overcome the attractive forces that hold them in place is called? [place]	melting point
What play several important roles in the human body? [body]	lipids
What is a measure that has both size and direction? [direction]	vector
What is to blame for water’s boiling point (100°c) being higher than the boiling points of similar substances? [substance]	hydrogen bonds
Carbonic acid decomposes easily at room temperature into carbon dioxide and what else? [room]	water
What form when a single atom gains or loses electrons? [electron]	monatomic ions
In earthworms, the skin serves as what type of organ? [earthworm]	respiratory
Catalytic converters used on motor vehicles break down pollutants in what, yielding non-toxic compounds? [vehicle]	exhaust
Processing of filtrate in the proximal tubule helps maintain what level in body fluid? [body]	ph
What helps represent age-sex structure of the population? [age]	population pyramid
Large viruses began as what type of cells inside bigger host cells? [host]	parasitic
How can you calculate the density of matter? [matter]	by dividing its mass by its volume
Frogs and toads have long back legs which are specialized for what action? [action]	jumping
Different regions of the cerebral cortex can be associated with particular functions, a concept known as what? [cortex]	localization of function
What is the term for a change in the inherited traits of organisms over time? [term]	evolution
What type of diseases do antibiotics not affect? [type]	viruses
Which system carries out long-distance transport of materials between the root and shoot systems? [distance]	vascular tissue system
How do reptiles typically reproduce? [reptile]	sexually
All organisms must adapt to what in order to survive? [organism]	environment
Biochemical compounds that include sugars, starches, and cellulose are examples of what? [cellulose]	carbohydrates
What emerges from an insect egg? [insect]	larva
What can protons and neutrons be broken down into? [can]	quarks
What is the name of the stage of life when a child becomes sexually mature? [stage]	puberty
What part of the brain is divided from front to back into the left and right hemispheres? [brain]	cerebrum
Because their cells are arranged in bundles, the appearance of skeletal and cardiac muscles is described as what? [appearance]	striated
What resource is considered nonrewable for human purposes, because it takes so long to form and is depleted by farming and other activities? [purpose]	soil
What in orange juice makes it taste sour? [taste]	citric acid
What scientist created the modern system for classifying organisms? [organism]	linnaeus
What will be the effect to an organism if its homeostasis is not maintained? [homeostasis]	death or disease
Since warmer molecules have more energy, they are more what? [molecule]	active
If only blue light strikes green leaves what happens to it? [strike]	it is absorbed
Which type of animal creates useful substances such as honey, wax, lacquer, and silk? [wax]	insects
Stringed instruments can help show the relationship between tension and what in strings? [tension]	frequencies
Ectotherms undergo a variety of changes at the cellular level to acclimatize to shifts in what? [ectotherm]	temperature
Convex lenses are thicker in the middle than at the edges so they cause rays of light to converge, or meet, at a point called what? [edge]	focus
What are magnesium carbonate, aluminum hydroxide, and sodium bicarbonate commonly used as? [sodium]	antacids
What type of taste do bases normally have? [taste]	bitter
Which body part helps roundworm prevent their body from expanding? [roundworm]	tough cuticle covering
The maintenance of constant conditions in the body is also known as what? [body]	homeostasis
What is the term for tough protein fibers that connects bones to each other? [term]	ligaments
What is the study of macroscopic properties, atomic properties, and phenomena in chemical systems? [property]	physical chemistry
Bones, cartilage, and ligaments make up what anatomical system? [ligament]	skeletal system
What is the first part of the large intestine called? [call]	cecum
What occurs when nature reclaims areas formerly occupied by life? [nature]	secondary succession
To solubilize the fats so that they can be absorbed, what organ secretes a fluid called bile into the small intestine? [fluid]	gall bladder
When the hemoglobin loses its oxygen, it changes to what color? [oxygen]	bluish red
How are weather patterns formed? [weather]	uneven heating of the atmosphere
Boyle discovered that what property of a gas is inversely proportional to its volume? [volume]	pressure
What amazing machines smash particles that are smaller than atoms into each other head-on? [head]	particle accelerators
The interaction of what opposite factors describe a biome and ecosystem? [interaction]	abiotic and biotic
What is caused by differences in density at the top and bottom of the ocean? [difference]	deep currents
What is the layer of tissue between the body and shell called? [tissue]	mantle
Well suited to absorb water and dissolved minerals from the soil, thin-walled dermal cells and tiny hairs cover what basic plant structures? [soil]	roots
What is the major artery of the body, taking oxygenated blood to the organs and muscles of the body? [muscle]	aorta
What do you call a growing mass of cancerous cells that pushes into nearby tissues? [tissue]	tumor
The enzyme pepsin plays an important role in the digestion of proteins by breaking down intact protein to what short-chain amino acids? [pepsin]	peptides
What remains a constant of radioactive substance over time? [substance]	rate of decay
Terrestrial ecosystems, also known for their diversity, are grouped into large categories called what? [ecosystem]	biomes
High explosives create shock waves that exceed the speed of sound, a phenomenon that goes by what term? [sound]	supersonic
What do you call a structure composed of two or more types of tissues that work together to do a specific task? [tissue]	organ
